commit_message:
Add a microversion for consumer generation

The previous patch added the 'generation' field to the consumer table.
This patch adds microversion 1.22 for handling that in requests as well
as including its values in any returned allocations.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: Ic5fe7d199fa3df39e19d3c93853959e8ebe6e157

commit_message:
Fix docs for IsolatedHostsFilter

The docs were using variable names from the filter code rather
than the actual config options.

Conflicts:
      doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The schedulers configuration doc is not
included in this backport since that doc didn't exist in
nova until Pike via commit da224b3a0.

Change-Id: I2694b32e9c90ad098101e41e4e3ae36ddafd8d0f
Related-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 60bbec15ed319ce703d49667b2649289639a86da)
(cherry picked from commit c1dfe464bbe2c1a5b0e306285a86c814ceff9e80)
(cherry picked from commit f510e2e7f00f612ad636f4e7fcc188d64285a889)

[{'created': '2018-02-12 21:58:26.000000000', 'message': "Handle volume-backed instances in IsolatedHostsFilter

The RequestSpec.image object for a volume-backed instance will
not have the 'id' attribute set because the
nova.utils.get_image_metadata_from_volume() method doesn't convert
the volume['volume_image_metadata']['image_id'] into the ImageMeta.id
field. It is unclear if there are intentional reasons for omitting
this information, but the IsolatedHostsFilter has just never supported
filtering for volume-backed instances based on a provided image id.

The logic within the filter depends on the
restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images config option, which
defaults to True. When True, a volume-backed instance will not be
put on an isolated host. When False, a volume-backed instance can
go on any host, isolated or not.

Again, it's unclear if we should actually be filtering volume-backed
servers using the image_id from the volume_image_metadata or not,
but it's not what we've historically done so this change simply
fixes the regression bug.

Change-Id: Ieb8abb1a3f04ce008f9617e051e4d720dbe6917a
Closes-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 0a7427dc58eeb271646a962604106e0e84b870b6)
(cherry picked from commit 4c6443c0b5579853f4b87eb8302d24aca99dddab)
(cherry picked from commit fb723851707d6a764cb8154343087affc19e5db0)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle volume-backed instances in IsolatedHostsFilter

The RequestSpec.image object for a volume-backed instance will
not have the 'id' attribute set because the
nova.utils.get_image_metadata_from_volume() method doesn't convert
the volume['volume_image_metadata']['image_id'] into the ImageMeta.id
field. It is unclear if there are intentional reasons for omitting
this information, but the IsolatedHostsFilter has just never supported
filtering for volume-backed instances based on a provided image id.

The logic within the filter depends on the
restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images config option, which
defaults to True. When True, a volume-backed instance will not be
put on an isolated host. When False, a volume-backed instance can
go on any host, isolated or not.

Again, it's unclear if we should actually be filtering volume-backed
servers using the image_id from the volume_image_metadata or not,
but it's not what we've historically done so this change simply
fixes the regression bug.

Change-Id: Ieb8abb1a3f04ce008f9617e051e4d720dbe6917a
Closes-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 0a7427dc58eeb271646a962604106e0e84b870b6)
(cherry picked from commit 4c6443c0b5579853f4b87eb8302d24aca99dddab)
(cherry picked from commit fb723851707d6a764cb8154343087affc19e5db0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 21:58:26.000000000', 'message': "Add regression test for BFV+IsolatedHostsFilter failure

Creating a volume-backed server while using the IsolatedHostsFilter
results in a NoValidHost failure because the filter tries to load
the RequestSpec.image.id but when you create a server from a volume,
an image is not required directly in the server create request.

NOTE(mriedem): The CinderFixture had to be used since the
CinderFixtureNewAttachFlow fixture didn't exist until Queens.

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test needed to change slightly to
disable the DiskFilter since we're using the PlacementFixture which
takes care of DISK_GB filtering.

Change-Id: Id21e0afa5cec401555bee679193c256e55be863b
Related-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 4f9667b7a92ffef4329380e39c64cf314203b06e)
(cherry picked from commit ed959b94ee8a211a270d9d89a6021e76a16bf31f)
(cherry picked from commit 3ff30f407c36264641ea8a1bfe8849d9e7a75f0e)
"}]
commit_message:
Add regression test for BFV+IsolatedHostsFilter failure

Creating a volume-backed server while using the IsolatedHostsFilter
results in a NoValidHost failure because the filter tries to load
the RequestSpec.image.id but when you create a server from a volume,
an image is not required directly in the server create request.

NOTE(mriedem): The CinderFixture had to be used since the
CinderFixtureNewAttachFlow fixture didn't exist until Queens.

NOTE(mriedem): The functional test needed to change slightly to
disable the DiskFilter since we're using the PlacementFixture which
takes care of DISK_GB filtering.

Change-Id: Id21e0afa5cec401555bee679193c256e55be863b
Related-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 4f9667b7a92ffef4329380e39c64cf314203b06e)
(cherry picked from commit ed959b94ee8a211a270d9d89a6021e76a16bf31f)
(cherry picked from commit 3ff30f407c36264641ea8a1bfe8849d9e7a75f0e)

commit_message:
Kuryr-Controller: make handlers pluggable

This patch introduces a new way for configuring which handlers the
Kuryr controller should be using. This will allow people to use
externally provided handlers as long as they are installed as
entrypoints of the right namespace.

Implements: blueprint kuryr-pluggable-handlers

Change-Id: I52ce0ef00771c8587d7f7113cc5eb4839d1309a5
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

changes the logstash data-directory to a bind mount which will ensure

commit_message:
Add bind mount for logstash and ensure java is installed

This change ensures java is installed where logstash is installed and
changes the logstash data-directory to a bind mount which will ensure
we're not running into space issues inside of our logstash container.

Change-Id: I43f7fb4a8641150c05dcde88a94b65e7c7d2f83a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Do not log passwords

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

Change-Id: I537d17f4a88b5acac840d632b1941fd15116fd9b
(cherry picked from commit 38449aa31ece7e512ccafeff7bba039981c24cdc)

(12 comments)

I'm having to take it on faith that this is achieving whatever goal it set out to achieve.  So just looking at it from a code perspective, I've got a number of issues.  They're described in more detail within, but to summarize:

- The main thrust of the patch seems to be that we're getting initiators for *all* VIOSes rather than just the nvl.  The commit message doesn't even mention that, instead focusing on locking, which doesn't seem to be a significant aspect of the change set.
- I'm -1 on the static _get_vios_uuids method.  Retrieve the IDs from within get_iscsi_initiators, by directly calling get_active_vioses.
- The _get_iscsi_conn_props business needs to be pulled out into a separate change set."}, {'account_id': 14806, 'date': '2018-04-12 20:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 14806, 'date': '2018-04-12 20:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

commit_message:
Return iSCSI Initiator for VIOSes

Adding the get_iscsi_initiators method in iscsi volume adapter
to discover all iSCSI initiators for active VIOSes and return
the first initiator from the sorted collection of initiators.

Change-Id: Ic842bd49e0a3dc6e4f4a3bf14409ca2f70369a26

subject: Update old python string format
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11809, 'name': 'Craig Bryant', 'email': 'craig.bryant@hpe.com', 'username': 'craig-bryant'}, {'_account_id': 16222, 'name': 'witek', 'email': 'witold.bedyk@suse.com', 'username': 'witek'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24580, 'name': 'James Gu', 'email': 'james.gu@microsoft.com', 'username': 'jamesgu'}, {'_account_id': 26639, 'name': 'Tobias Johansson', 'email': 'tjohansson@op5.com', 'username': 'tobiajo'}, {'_account_id': 26702, 'name': 'Nicolas Seyvet', 'email': 'nseyvet@op5.com', 'username': 'nseyvet'}, {'_account_id': 26733, 'name': 'Amir Mofakhar', 'email': 'amir@mofakhar.info', 'username': 'amofakhar'}, {'_account_id': 28075, 'name': 'Jui Chandwaskar', 'email': 'jchandwaskar@op5.com', 'username': 'jchandwaskar'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28075, 'date': '2018-04-16 11:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28075, 'date': '2018-04-16 11:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26702, 'date': '2018-04-16 13:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24580, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2018-04-16 17:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The real problem is the that "{}" format is not used for self.log.debug. Instead, it should be "%s". Switching to %s would be better as that way the formatting is only done if debug logging is on. The way you have this coded, the strings are completely formatted every time regardless of log level'}, {'account_id': 26733, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28075, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hello Craig,

As per python documentation:

str.format(*args, **kwargs)
...
This method of string formatting is the new standard in Python 3, and should be preferred to the % formatting described in String Formatting Operations in new code.
New in version 2.6.
Reference: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/stdtypes.html#string-methods'}, {'account_id': 28075, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28075, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Nicolas and Craig! Got the difference now, 
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html?highlight=log%20debug#logging.debug
https://reinout.vanrees.org/weblog/2015/06/05/logging-formatting.html

Updated the patch with %s formatting.'}, {'account_id': 11809, 'date': '2018-04-17 14:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Ju, looks good. Thanks for fixing this'}, {'account_id': 24580, 'date': '2018-04-17 15:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26639, 'date': '2018-04-17 15:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26702, 'date': '2018-04-17 15:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2018-04-17 15:23:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Update old python string format

Currently kubernetes.py debug statement prints utilizes old
string format, thus leading to
TypeError: not all arguments converted during string formatting

Fixed the string format function in debug statements.

Change-Id: I4ef602cf356082ed3d5e8a924336f38a84179430
Task: 14309
Story: 2001857
Signed-off-by: Jui Chandwaskar <jchandwaskar@op5.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-07 16:38:33.000000000', 'message': "Run api sample tests against 2.latest

By running api sample tests against a specific microversion we risk
regressions like in this patch's related bug. This patch runs all api
samples tests agaisnt 2.latest, whatever 2.latest happens to be at the
time. While this doesn't cover all microversions, it makes sure that
going forward, all microversions will be test with the full battery of
api sample tests.

To achieve this, a new 2.latest test scenario is added to all api
sample tests. All tests need to pass in the microversion they were
written for, and - assuming that what they're testing hasn't been
deprecated and removed from the API - in the 2.latest microversion.
This means simply passing a version to the template-getting logic
isn't enough, since that would imply a sample for every test for every
new microversion going forward. Instead, a new version_intervals dict
is introduced, which indicates at which points in the API version
timeline requests and responses have changed. Thus, only when there is
a change in the API is a new sample needed. Existing tests and the
template-getting logic are adjusted to use this new dict.

Change-Id: Ide831ac09649a78e0f1971ad4fa99add8d340ec2
Related-bug: 1658571

commit_message:
Run api sample tests against 2.latest

By running api sample tests against a specific microversion we risk
regressions like in this patch's related bug. This patch runs all api
samples tests against 2.latest, whatever 2.latest happens to be at the
time. While this doesn't cover all microversions, it makes sure that
going forward, all new microversions will be tested with the full
battery of api sample tests.

Change-Id: Ide831ac09649a78e0f1971ad4fa99add8d340ec2
Related-bug: 1658571

set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I76c2528d825a5f66d34c21a02abf099b8dc547ec

commit_message:
Clean up W503 and E402 pep8 errors

pycodestyle 2.40 and later enforce these rules that were not previously
enforced. Rather than just skipping them, this cleans up the trivial
instances of these violations.

This does also include some other updates that were not triggering errors
in an attempt to keep some of the style consistent.

Change-Id: Id7c0a6b8f1f835e69d844b000e3ed751852ada63
Closes-bug: #1762803

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Update the lower bound for PrettyTable so the unit tests pass.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ia146248b505e66adf871d17ae1e4921d7888bb85
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Oslo releases for 2018-4-16

About half are just eventlet uncaps, plus the usual assortment of
new features and bugfixes.

commit_message:
Helm-Toolkit: Kubernetes Entrypoint, simplify image dependencies

This PS simplify the logic for dyanmicly merging the image management
depenencies into pod deps when active.

Change-Id: I0cf6c93173bc5fbce697ac15be8697d3b1326d0a

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Because flake8 now runs under python 3 there is no built-in name
'file'. Instead we can use the same symbols from the io module to
build the spec for mocking out the open() call. The old version of
that code that used to only run under python 3 used a private version
of the io module, so that is also corrected.

Change-Id: I2491e65736d2c79f1134eec6371967c39873891b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add skip_latest_microversion decorator

In preparation for running api sample tests against 2.latest, add a
new skip_latest_microversion decorator. This will be necessary to
skip tests that can't be made to pass with 2.latest, for example
because the API they're testing has been deprecated and removed.

Change-Id: I1ca08516d7ccacfc88b2c0e7048b60d58694615b

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: I1b90426757130f9e8f32eb4882746bb44b3cf1e3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Transform aggregate.update_metadata notification

The aggregate.update_metadata.start and aggregate.update_metadata.end
notifications has been transformed to the versioned notification framework.

Co-Authored-By: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Iab73b1351a50869620334f692aaefb566ba4ddf8
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-rocky

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Because flake8 runs under python 3, where the type "long" has been
merged into int(), we have to ignore the error from the undefined name
in one of the tests.

Change-Id: I86ae7f83d17724d74bae7102dd1775eceb82599d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
ffwd-upgrade cli - adds ffwd_upgrade_converge_plan task for noops

This adds the ffwd_upgrade_converge_plan task in the package_update
workbook. This is invoked from the related tripleoclient review.
Unlike the converge_upgrade_plan task this doesn't run a heat stack
update. Instead it just runs the plan remove_noop_deploystep
which removes OS::Heat::None from DeploymentSteps. The rest of the
ffwd related heat resources are unset using the upgrade-converge
environment file, in the client side, see related review below.

Related:
  python-tripleoclient Ie7823e121a4fa57feb1c56bd4d58f3183e41b8d7
Change-Id: Ib9647b899fb9d49203c4d35c1abfe9c36e0babbe

commit_message:
Fixed tempestconf directory for newton

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551441/ refactored the whole
  validate-tempest role. It introduced a regression at few places.
  It fixes the path of tempestconf directory to use tempest_dir.

Change-Id: I69deba467157ad2134616aacec4368a5d0f5b92e

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

As part of updating the pep8 job to run python 3 we need to remove the
use of the python 2 builtin unicode(). We can use six.text_type() to
produce the same result until we drop python 2 support.

Change-Id: I43c03aeb73bb8a246115400bcbd9a0a68708abd9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 11:24:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing RBAC config for Prometheus

Currently the prometheus service is broken because the RBAC config is
missing. The patch just adds it to make it work again.

And the namespace of prometheus and grafana are also changed in this
patch to get a better isolation.

Closes-Bug: #1755772

Change-Id: I05affd9091ad13d70cc074b45d204162f2f4b21e
(cherry picked from commit d07fb7f3cc0c16ad597e930c37b042c26ac78049)
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing RBAC config for Prometheus

Currently the prometheus service is broken because the RBAC config is
missing. The patch just adds it to make it work again.

And the namespace of prometheus and grafana are also changed in this
patch to get a better isolation.

Closes-Bug: #1755772

Change-Id: I05affd9091ad13d70cc074b45d204162f2f4b21e
(cherry picked from commit d07fb7f3cc0c16ad597e930c37b042c26ac78049)

commit_message:
Add KMIP key manager

Adds the KMIP key manager to Castellan and also injects the default
values for the key manager into the conf file. A following patch
will include unit tests and documentation.

Change-Id: I7862e4e16e23ec2dd29ab734737c6890248b358c
Partially-Implements: blueprint kmip-key-manager

commit_message:
Do not log passwords

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

Change-Id: I537d17f4a88b5acac840d632b1941fd15116fd9b
(cherry picked from commit 38449aa31ece7e512ccafeff7bba039981c24cdc)

https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/systemd/

systemd service files are included in the MariaDB-server package. The service definition is installed in /usr/lib/systemd/system/mariadb.service. commit_message:
Adjust 'overcloud upgrade prepare' call for P->Q upgrade.

During P->Q upgrade we need to pass 'roles-file' to the upgrade
 prepare command.
To address issue described in RHBZ#1541024 we'll pass all the
 environment files, used during initial overcloud deploy.

Change-Id: I1a655cf52630c5eec0387cbea4c480d8072a13f2

subject: Stop printing flavor details on successful flavor-delete
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-04-17 03:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-04-17 04:22:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-04-17 12:54:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

'openstack flavor delete' does not print anything out at all if it is successful.
Looks good to me.
Thanks , Matt."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 14:33:02.000000000', 'message': 'Stop printing flavor details on successful flavor-delete

It's weird that the flavor-delete CLI would print out the
details of the flavor the user just deleted, rather than give
some confirmation message, or simply not print anything out
at all, which is arguably more expected behavior when deleting
a resource. This change simply removes the output on successful
deletion which brings "nova flavor-delete" more inline with other
delete CLIs, including "openstack flavor delete" behavior.

While in here, the variable and docstring code is updated to
reflect reality and a release note is added in case anyone was
ever relying on this odd behavior.

Change-Id: Ie3e07b45cc70213cde4e6077c604c9f2835c75ad
Closes-Bug: #1764420
'}]
commit_message:
Stop printing flavor details on successful flavor-delete

It's weird that the flavor-delete CLI would print out the
details of the flavor the user just deleted, rather than give
some confirmation message, or simply not print anything out
at all, which is arguably more expected behavior when deleting
a resource. This change simply removes the output on successful
deletion which brings "nova flavor-delete" more inline with other
delete CLIs, including "openstack flavor delete" behavior.

While in here, the variable and docstring code is updated to
reflect reality and a release note is added in case anyone was
ever relying on this odd behavior.

Change-Id: Ie3e07b45cc70213cde4e6077c604c9f2835c75ad
Closes-Bug: #1764420

commit_message:
Replaced action timeout with action deadline

In some cases (concurrency policy or message redelivered) a
action timeout must be reduced to prevent inconsistent state between
task and actions.

Change-Id: Ic09f2c4fa4293f1d1be5a9f98ff67a7dc23d0bd7
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 16:29:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for deploying Kafka

Projects which may use Kafka include Monasca and Oslo
messaging. Initially it will be possible to
deploy a single Kafka cluster which may be shared
among clients. Support for running multiple Kafka
clusters may be added in a future change. This
change also configures logging for Kafka server,
state-change and controller logs.

Depends-On: I79a5a32ee8e5edd915fa88fbc00d0d4ac08b8ebd
for Kafka image
Depends-On: I745f3d5949be66f8463e1e1a3d02b25d2606d256
for Zookeeper image
Depends-On: Idc01afcb125271181ee5e15d327d0929f07b49e9
for deploying Zookeeper

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers
Change-Id: Iab8d200c2450238f3c0c708d1f4184490f6e6284

commit_message:
Add support for deploying Kafka

Projects which may use Kafka include Monasca and Oslo
messaging. Initially it will be possible to
deploy a single Kafka cluster which may be shared
among clients. Support for running multiple Kafka
clusters may be added in a future change. This
change also configures logging for Kafka server,
state-change and controller logs.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: Iab8d200c2450238f3c0c708d1f4184490f6e6284

commit_message:
Document how to disable notifications

This adds information to the "notification_format" config
option help and notifications docs on how to disable notifications.

While updating the config option help text, a stale reference
to Pike is removed.

Change-Id: I736025a0a88fc969831558805687b642da8cd365
Closes-Bug: #1761405

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 16:18:46.000000000', 'message': 'Pin pycodestyle to <=2.3.1

2.4.0 broke our pep8 tests pretty hard:
http://logs.openstack.org/20/531320/14/check/openstack-tox-pep8/c9d9d10/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-10_15_43_40_014738

Pin pycodestyle until we have time to fix all of those.

Note that this is in the global-requirements blacklist to allow
projects to manage those versions on their own:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/b94a4e8c8fadbdc4c5cac9c4da6755a3c06a7824/blacklist.txt#L13

Conflicts:
    test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I6b0d458c702684779eb21e7022dd0f3193ac72d2
Story: 2001819
(cherry picked from commit fc15be6e329a41ab4cf634c53a54441694c41195)
'}]
commit_message:
Pin pycodestyle to <=2.3.1

2.4.0 broke our pep8 tests pretty hard:
http://logs.openstack.org/20/531320/14/check/openstack-tox-pep8/c9d9d10/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-10_15_43_40_014738

Pin pycodestyle until we have time to fix all of those.

Note that this is in the global-requirements blacklist to allow
projects to manage those versions on their own:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/b94a4e8c8fadbdc4c5cac9c4da6755a3c06a7824/blacklist.txt#L13

Conflicts:
    test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I6b0d458c702684779eb21e7022dd0f3193ac72d2
Story: 2001819
(cherry picked from commit fc15be6e329a41ab4cf634c53a54441694c41195)

commit_message:
Pass APIVersionRequest to extensions

Previously, extensions' get_server_create_schema() was passed the
microversion number as a string. This made comparisons such as
version == '2.32' possible, and led to this patch's related bug. This
patch passes an APIVersionRequest object to extensions and removes
APIVersionRequest's __eq__ operator to prevent future code from doing
version equality comparisons, which should never be necessary.

Change-Id: Ic09f4f783307b559c61b1fb522275fd4a0e5f5aa
Related-bug: 1658571
Implements: blueprint fix-tag-attribute-disappearing

commit_message:
Update heat-base hierata to match puppet-heat change

Since Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b, we need www_authenticate_uri
(the patch doesn't seem backward compatible as it ignores auth_uri).
Let's update THT to match this new requirement.

Related-Bug: #1764598
Change-Id: Ib6664ab5e68fbb93ba43e4fdd4b65bee1221c1d6

commit_message:
use rpc Connection rather than create_connection

The create_connection function in neutron.common.rpc is just an alias to
Connection. This patch switches to the later so we can remove the former
in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560130

Change-Id: I97f940cf3a65ecae202081130b60927ac0cfd467

commit_message:
Application version support

Set the vault app version in juju status using the version
returned from the Vault health data (rather than the installed
snap).

This review also puts in place the atexit handling needed for
general status assessment.

Change-Id: I1f8f0991534f4e130e924ffac733fa13141f0970

commit_message:
Modify default collector as gnocchi in devstack

Ceilometer API is deprecated in Ocata Release[1].
Set collector backend=gnocchi to get metrics from Gnocchi.

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ceilometer/ocata.html#deprecation-notes

commit_message:
Enforce env_variables values to string before run

Converts extra_env_variables values to string because processutils
expect them to be so.

Change-Id: If033001d53f9163ef998fcd162dff1b76fb586d7
Closes-Bug: #1761232

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: EVPN linuxbridge driver, avoid except when bridge is gone

This change removes a stacktrace that appears when a route
is removed and the bridge for the instance has been deleted.

It also ensure that "bridge fdb dump" info is only
retrieved when the log level is DEBUG.

Change-Id: Ie66c7f1132d186495502d8101236a368eb6d4935
Closes-Bug: 1764353

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 11:08:43.000000000', 'message': 'only increment disk address unit for scsi devices

We were erroneously incrementing the disk address unit attribute for
non-scsi devices, which resulted in inconsistent disk device naming and
addresses when SCSI devices were used along with non-SCSI devices (like
configdrive devices).

Also, we ensure that we assign unit number 0 for the boot volume of a
boot-from-volume instance.

Change-Id: Ia91e2f9c316e25394a0f41dc341d903dfcff6921
Co-authored-by: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@sileht.net>
Closes-bug: #1729584
Closes-bug: #1753394
(cherry picked from commit 2616b384e642b6eb58eef7da87b6e893f25a949e)
'}, {'created': '2018-04-16 13:04:22.000000000', 'message': 'only increment disk address unit for scsi devices

We were erroneously incrementing the disk address unit attribute for
non-scsi devices, which resulted in inconsistent disk device naming and
addresses when SCSI devices were used along with non-SCSI devices (like
configdrive devices).

Also, we ensure that we assign unit number 0 for the boot volume of a
boot-from-volume instance.

Change-Id: Ia91e2f9c316e25394a0f41dc341d903dfcff6921
Co-authored-by: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@sileht.net>
Closes-bug: #1729584

commit_message:
only increment disk address unit for scsi devices

We were erroneously incrementing the disk address unit attribute for
non-scsi devices, which resulted in inconsistent disk device naming and
addresses when SCSI devices were used along with non-SCSI devices (like
configdrive devices).

Also, we ensure that we assign unit number 0 for the boot volume of a
boot-from-volume instance.

Change-Id: Ia91e2f9c316e25394a0f41dc341d903dfcff6921
Co-authored-by: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@sileht.net>
Closes-bug: #1729584
Closes-bug: #1753394
(cherry picked from commit 2616b384e642b6eb58eef7da87b6e893f25a949e)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-02 09:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-10-02 14:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/508175/2/ : FAILURE in 4h 30m 55s'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-03 08:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-10-03 11:57:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/508175/3/ : FAILURE in 3h 37m 08s'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-10-03 22:10:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

My comments weren't addressed in the previous PS so I'm putting a -2 on this so it's sticky.

I'm also -2 on this pcimanager-based approach as previously described."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-04 09:56:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> My comments weren't addressed in the previous PS so I'm putting a -2
> on this so it's sticky.

The previous comments you did, suffer from the lack of details and
reveal an incomprehension of the base code.

If you can elaborate a bit more, I could help you to understand.

> I'm also -2 on this pcimanager-based approach as previously
> described.

This approach based on adding mdev support to the PciManager is the
one accepted by the kernel upstream and have support of Intel, NVIDIA
and also IBM.

The PciManager is going to be used in any case since it's not possible
to abstract more of that the different kind of virtual functions you
want to maintain and communicate to the virt layers.

An other point, the spec approved for vGPUs is based on Xen approach
which abstract the whole part. That solution has not been accepted by
kernel. XenSource are providing a downstream-only version of their
DEMU and only NVIDIA currently provide drivers. More of that they
have interest of porting vfio, so at some point we could just have
mdev/sriov."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2017-10-05 14:47:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> An other point, the spec approved for vGPUs is based on Xen approach which abstract the whole part. That solution has not been accepted by kernel.

There is no dependency between the approved spec and XenServer or DEMU.  The whole intention of the approved spec is to be abstracted from a particular hypervisors' implementation - in this case libvirt.

> XenSource are providing a downstream-only version of their
DEMU and only NVIDIA currently provide drivers.

XenServer's integration with all types of virtual GPU is abstracted from the underlying hardware implementation.  Integration with MxGPU, GVT-g and vGPU are all using different methods as agreed with each relevant vendor and none of them are using mdev.

> More of that they have interest of porting vfio, so at some point we could just have
mdev/sriov.

XenServer has no plans to adopt vfio or mdev and hyper-v cannot use mdev.  I am yet to hear from VMWare on their plans.

In either case, I would be a strong -1 on this until we have an approved spec."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-05 20:09:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> There is no dependency between the approved spec and XenServer or
> DEMU.  The whole intention of the approved spec is to be abstracted
> from a particular hypervisors' implementation - in this case
> libvirt.

Well there are, Xen infra is abstracting the whole hardware
implementation and provides a devices management. For libvirt it's
different it does require a devices management to make the link
between requests and devices (/pci/PciManager).

> XenServer's integration with all types of virtual GPU is abstracted
> from the underlying hardware implementation.  Integration with
> MxGPU, GVT-g and vGPU are all using different methods as agreed with
> each relevant vendor and none of them are using mdev.

As you confirmed everything is abstracted. It's not the case for
libvirt that is why the spec approved just does not work and does not
provide any relevant detail for libvirt implementation.

The basic support proposed is related to hack the libvirt driver to
by-pass everything and just read the flavor property to write the
correct XML (all of that can be done right now with the
FlavorPropertyFilter).  Since you don't want to use my work related to
add mdev support in PciManager, the only piece of code who manages the
devices, you will have to add and maintain in the driver a basic
datastructure to link the requests with devices.

All of that work is going to be removed (I hope) when that generic
device management will happen.

> In either case, I would be a strong -1 on this until we have an
> approved spec.

Thanks for your support. My hope is to make co-exist the work on-going
with the ResourceProvider and existing code as a transition which
seems reasonable regarding the alternative."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-09 11:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-09 12:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

commit_message:
pci: update PciDevice object field 'address' to accept NULL

A physical PCI device which provides virtual functions can expose them
using SRIOV framework which creates virtual PCI devices or MDEV
framework which creates virtual devices available thought sysfs.

In order to handle MDEV virtual functions, the PciDevice object should
accept receive NULL value for address field.

Change-Id: I6f39be4c99bc9f2de9ad079844496f8ab608b341
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

subject: pci: add support for mdev device type

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/508178/4/ : SUCCESS in 2h 49m 10s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-10-13 23:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I've looked at most of this series, and this review applies to the whole thing.  This particular change set was the most worrisome, so I'm putting my comments here.

The existing PCI manager code is a mess.  Speaking as a driver owner in general, it's extremely hard to follow, hard to debug, and hard to develop against.  Speaking as the owner of a driver that's not Linux-based, the problems are compounded exponentially.  In PowerVM, we have to do a very delicate dance to e.g. spoof PCI addresses and avoid any code paths that expect sysfs to be present and populated.  And even then, there are things we simply cannot do.

Every time this code is touched, we break.

I know that doesn't garner a lot of sympathy since we're an out-of-tree driver, but it's a pain point worth mentioning.  (It's also noteworthy that we're moving our driver in tree - we just haven't gotten to the PCI bits yet.)

PowerVM's agenda aside, it is clear from the substance of some of the comments in this series that there are roadblocks both technical and procedural that would need to be overcome to get this effort moving.  Technically it represents a significant feature whose very premise contains at least two major points of contention.  To be explicit:

- Mucking with the existing PCI manager code.  This is "throwing good money after bad" - spending valuable developer and reviewer resources on something that's reviled and being replaced.
- Continuing to pepper what ought to be general-purpose Nova code with libvirt-specific semantics (in this case mdev).

Procedurally, if I understand correctly, there is no blueprint or spec for this effort.  That seems like a major miss.  This feature has all the earmarks of something that needs one: data model impact, upgrade impact, deployer impact, developer impact, etc.  (Not that I'm suggesting you go rushing out to write one.  Spec freeze is in a week, and it's going to be all we can do to get the current proposals finalized.)

But my major concern is that the discussion and eventual resolution of these issues would come at a nontrivial cost of reviewer time.  We have a tightly-defined but substantial set of work that needs to be done in Queens to achieve our goals.  And whereas the team always needs to account for reviewer bandwidth for minor features and bugfixes along with approved and agreed-upon blueprint work, this series represents none of those things.

However, there's work in the pipe with a very real possibility of being ready early enough in Queens to enable what you're trying to do with this series.  In fact, it's possible that you can do what you need with the code that's already merged.  This is work you'll have to do anyway once we get to the point where we can slate the PCI manager for the incinerator.  This series represents what will ultimately be throwaway code.

What would be really helpful is if, instead of spending time on this approach which clearly has opposition, you could redirect that time toward the specs and patches that will make it possible for you to implement this same feature under the framework of the future rather than the past.  Obviously this benefits you in multiple ways, not least of which is allowing you to provide input on the direction being taken so you can ensure that it meets your needs.

For my part, I'm more than willing to help you design how to model and implement your solution within the framework that's in place and what's coming down the pipe.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-04-17 12:43:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
pci: add support for mdev device type

Provide support for mdev device. While for PCI related devices we
match by vendor, product, address. For MDEV related devices we match
by vendor and/or mdev_type.  In this commit we make the resource pool
stats able to also handle MDEV based devices and manager to accept
handling such device

Change-Id: I2607f37a43c5983f062dfcd34265f31d3915b750
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

subject: pci: add for PciDevice object new field mdev

[{'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-09-28 14:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-09-28 15:53:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As I've said many times, I'm really really -2 on us building more custom snowflake stuff into the existing PCI code like this.

If the libvirt driver exposed inventory for a gpu resource class right now, you could make flavors that schedule on it. If the libvirt driver gave instances a vcpu device if the flavor asked for it, then we're done with basic support. No DB, object, or legacy code changes required."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-09-29 08:55:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> As I've said many times, I'm really really -2 on us building more
> custom snowflake stuff into the existing PCI code like this.

We should avoid easy criticisms, more of that when they come without
arguments. The fact is this framework is a first implementation on
something *complex* and it's used every day by large industries, also,
I just have proven that with some simple changes it can support more.

> If the libvirt driver exposed inventory for a gpu resource class
> right now, you could make flavors that schedule on it. If the
> libvirt driver gave instances a vcpu device if the flavor asked for
> it, then we're done with basic support. No DB, object, or legacy
> code changes required.

When you are talking about *basic support* on something still
*experimental* I'm talking of a fully functional support and
production-ready feature, more of that, it's proposed at the very
beginning of the release."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-02 09:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-10-02 15:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Since virtual functions provided thgouth MDEV are exposing UUID
instead-of virtual PCI address. We introduce a new field 'mdev' to
store it. The commit also provides API to update/delete device from
mdev and update the PciDevice Object methods to claim/allocate
devices.

Change-Id: Ia8706ad18f395a3d6003f0654df1a9fa498deb77
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pci: add for PciDevice object new field mdev

The MDEV devices are identified using an UUID so this commit introduce
a new field mdev to the PciDevice.

Other caracteristics are used to identify a kind of MDEV devices like
the type or the name. They will have to be added as a new key in
extra_info.

Change-Id: Ia8706ad18f395a3d6003f0654df1a9fa498deb77
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pci: generalize object unit-tests for different framework

The current object unit-tests are using SRIOV devices. In this commit
we generalize the unit-tests so that in future there are executed for
MDEV devices.

Change-Id: If98c7787db8a0070dd559287c015eb37552c2497
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
pci: generalize stats unit-tests for different framework

The current unit-tests executedfor pci/stats are using SRIOV
devices. In this commit we generalize the unit-tests so that in future
there are executed executed for MDEV devices.

Change-Id: Ia8fd09478ea87edc3899fd1fc39e40fc35ea78a5
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
functional: rework fakelibvirt host pci devices

In this commit we rework the class HostPciDevices to make it able
providing more than SRIOV capabilities

Change-Id: Idfc48e348575e0673889525d4c9fd919fbaa35a2
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: add support to start vm with using mdev (vGPU)

The pci manager is now returning a virtual devices using mdev. This
commit is to make the driver to expose it to the guest.

Change-Id: I5edaf50271f139455ab7ad83ca3d7a7b2ae48314
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-14 15:25:33.000000000', 'message': "Properly get pip version

The old code was strip()ing the version string instead of split()ing the
version string so we always got the first character of the version
string. This worked fine as long as the pip version was single digit but
as soon as it rolls over to '10.stuff' we will compare:

  pip version 1 (instead of 10) > 6

Which fails bceause 1 is less than six. Instaed we really do want to
compare 10 > 6 so use split on '.' instead.

Change-Id: Ic7d0c04d7fa77774ab2d70fb9d11f182becec553

commit_message:
Properly get pip version

The old code was strip()ing the version string instead of split()ing the
version string so we always got the first character of the version
string. This worked fine as long as the pip version was single digit but
as soon as it rolls over to '10.stuff' we will compare:

  pip version 1 (instead of 10) > 6

Which fails bceause 1 is less than six. Instaed we really do want to
compare 10 > 6 so use split on '.' instead.

Closes-Bug: #1764046
Change-Id: Ic7d0c04d7fa77774ab2d70fb9d11f182becec553
(cherry picked from commit 065779517f9c99a80fbc39d51784c614e4ee341c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 17:11:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrapping of neutron forbidden error

In neutronv2 api, the neutron forbidden error is not wrapped
correctly. The exception class expects the first parameter as
the error message but an exception object is passed.

Closes-Bug: #1720726
Change-Id: I6e88333427ec2befe2122274b02775f013404e30
(cherry picked from commit f1a0557da4fbd7baa9196cb5c0ccdd7ebb16ecdf)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrapping of neutron forbidden error

In neutronv2 api, the neutron forbidden error is not wrapped
correctly. The exception class expects the first parameter as
the error message but an exception object is passed.

Closes-Bug: #1720726
Change-Id: I6e88333427ec2befe2122274b02775f013404e30
(cherry picked from commit f1a0557da4fbd7baa9196cb5c0ccdd7ebb16ecdf)

I don't think it's the good fix. We should update IsolatedHostFilter to verify whether the instance is booted from volume and so check into the image property for image_id to do the correlation."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2016-11-15 11:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

And so, we should be able to backport the fix'}, {'account_id': 14819, 'date': '2016-11-15 12:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

sahid, could you please provide more details that? What problems with backporting this will we have?'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2016-11-16 10:57:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

During boot we copy the image metadata, so instances which already exist still do not have that 'id' attribute on their metadata. During a migration of these instances the same error is going to happen from the filter. That is why I'd say backport that change is not something we might want.

If we fix the real root cause which is on the filter, we could backport it and all cases are going to success."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2017-07-05 03:08:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> During boot we copy the image metadata, so instances which already
 > exist still do not have that 'id' attribute on their metadata.
 > During a migration of these instances the same error is going to
 > happen from the filter. That is why I'd say backport that change is
 > not something we might want.
 > 
 > If we fix the real root cause which is on the filter, we could
 > backport it and all cases are going to success.

Thanks for the review, seems correct"}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2017-07-05 03:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20040, 'date': '2017-07-05 04:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
copy image id to image metadata from volume

According to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204947/ image id is
considered to be
useless and ignored to put to image metadata, but actually, it is used for
IsolatedHostsFilter: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1584747
we should add it back.

Change-Id: Ic0e79cc19a5750373db34b6afa776ff5fcdd0b32
closes-bug: #1584752
closes-bug: #1584747

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 11:58:00.000000000', 'message': "ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472
"}]
commit_message:
ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node

_node_resources_unavailable() is supposed to be called after
_node_resources_used() returns False. Because get_inventory() doesn't
satisfy this condition, this method returns an empty inventory for a
deployed bare metal node. It causes the resource tracker to try
removing an allocated inventory from placement. This removal results
in periodic unexpected errors.

This patch calls _node_resources_used() prior to
_node_resources_unanvailable() for getting a proper inventory.

Change-Id: I6717ce19f6005c8ebb7af75437a72876c5a53f34
Closes-Bug: 1751472

commit_message:
Consume RoleData config from config download files

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525260/, we moved the creation of
various RoleData driven config files to deploy-steps-tasks.yaml, and to
consume the values from various role_data_* variables that were written in
the inventory (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528354/).

However, we were already downloading and saving the RoleData to separate
files via config download. We should consume from those files instead of
the inventory. That has the advantage that one can quickly modify and
iterate on the local files, and have those changes applied. That is
harder to do when these values are in the inventory, and not possible to
do when using dynamic inventory.

Since the tasks will fail trying to read from the files when not using
config-download, conditional local_action tasks that use the stat module
first verify the existence of the files before attempting to read their
contents. If they don't exist, the values fall back to whatever has been
defined by the ansible variable.

Change-Id: Idfdce6f0a778b0a7f2fed17ff56d1a3e451868ab
Closes-Bug: #1749784

commit_message:
Fix Alarm Details section in Alarm History view

The change adds dimension key/value pairs to the list of associated
metrics in Alarm Details section of Alarm History view. Without this
list the output is incomplete and confusing.

Story: 2001804
Task: 12529

Change-Id: Ifeaa713a9921d95c1f4ed0b25f28fe9fc7fdd3fe
(cherry picked from commit 841805bffcc9f99c8d2b079f58d9dfb46397a878)

commit_message:
Update prepare using an environment file

We'll be using t-h-t environment files to insert and remove no-ops in
the plan/stack. This should help make the update/upgrade Mistral
workflows more release-agnostic and thus reduce the risk of bugs in
mixed-release UC/OC enviornments.

Depends-On: I486ad0d44f105a6fa9fd24dcf7ac28d40ceecc27
Change-Id: If173d5f6e0be71f467bd062627e9f17e8b684b99

'}, {'created': '2018-04-05 13:15:19.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Add upgrade-[prepare|converge].yaml into upgrade cli

This explicitly adds the upgrade-prepare.yaml environment file
or the upgrade-converge.yaml environment file, into the stored
swift plan, before continuing with the previous workflow (here
heat stack update in both cases). See dependency below in tht
and this tie-in is the biggest downside I can see.

and move all the upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade cli to use the
same and include the expected environment file.

commit_message:
Add upgrade-[prepare|converge].yaml into upgrade cli

This explicitly adds the upgrade-prepare.yaml environment file
or the upgrade-converge.yaml environment file, into the stored
swift plan, before continuing with the previous workflow (here
heat stack update in both cases). See dependency below in tht
and this tie-in is the biggest downside I can see.

The idea is to stop doing it in the tripleo-common like [1][2]
and move all the upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade cli to use the
same and include the expected environment file.

Co-Authored-By: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/6090d32b516f92837fc8b01b7a55dc97ed3e8a77/tripleo_common/actions/package_update.py#L62-L76
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/6090d32b516f92837fc8b01b7a55dc97ed3e8a77/tripleo_common/actions/plan.py#L492-L502
Depends-On: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c
Change-Id: I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2

commit_message:
Add always tag where it's needed

When running the nova role with the "nova-config" tag the role will
result in failure due to registered variables not being available. This
change simply adds the always tag where it's needed so that the various
tags in the os_nova role can work together or independently.

Change-Id: Id5e8dd2df3c0cbf7cc2e0cf20b5731928dd6a18d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3cb998becd0666d0d449a961aa784fea458486d3)

commit_message:
networking-bgpvpn: remove networking-odl from required-projects

networking-bgpvpn does not need to draw networking-odl from
git anymore, and the current master of networking-odl causes
a failure to install (see details in bug 1764371).

Change-Id: Ia2154742e9a5a214ff2a59f3035bba3ed790f5f9
Partial-Bug: 1764371

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-17 09:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck linters job fixed'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-04-17 11:34:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 09:20:08.000000000', 'message': "Stop using -python35-jobs-horizon for trove-dashboard

We trie to make the py35 jobs temporarily disabled for stable branches
of trove-dashboard in I3421c945534dc249c42cef9977398ce6c376436e,
however it was not working as expected. Recently I found monasca-ui did
a similar change and worked, the difference is that monasca-ui is not
using the openstack-python35-jobs-horizon template, so the problem
should be the 'branches' attribute defined in projects.yaml cannot be
applied the jobs inheritted from project templates.

Change-Id: I34984c0c1942686d751e59adf37b920b66bd15cd
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using -python35-jobs-horizon for trove-dashboard

We trie to make the py35 jobs temporarily disabled for stable branches
of trove-dashboard in I3421c945534dc249c42cef9977398ce6c376436e,
however it was not working as expected. Recently I found monasca-ui did
a similar change and worked, the difference is that monasca-ui is not
using the openstack-python35-jobs-horizon template, so the problem
should be the 'branches' attribute defined in projects.yaml cannot be
applied the jobs inheritted from project templates.

Change-Id: I34984c0c1942686d751e59adf37b920b66bd15cd
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 07:26:51.000000000', 'message': 'Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ia254c2a0d12c236d595337aa1f7a9ded7d4ba158
(cherry picked from commit fa1884191903944b88e676434aaa1c984b2c2f27)
'}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ia254c2a0d12c236d595337aa1f7a9ded7d4ba158
(cherry picked from commit fa1884191903944b88e676434aaa1c984b2c2f27)

subject: Fix kernel post-installation script
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-13 12:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:43:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 12:59:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)

commit_message:
Add missing RBAC config for Prometheus

Currently the prometheus service is broken because the RBAC config is
missing. The patch just adds it to make it work again.

And the namespace of prometheus and grafana are also changed in this
patch to get a better isolation.

Closes-Bug: #1755772

Change-Id: I05affd9091ad13d70cc074b45d204162f2f4b21e

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Ief2fecbc266adcc816336b601253d3e90c39c32b
Closes-Bug: #1763300
(cherry picked from commit f451c1a3e2dff69edaf3a72fc215ffa46104a295)

(3 comments)

Can you get a look at the gnocchi collector ? I don't understand how it can work with the provided metric.yml (no reference to service-objects, use service dict as collector entry but no matching reference to it in the metrics list, etc) and keep the compatibility.

See also my other remarks on the orchestrator"}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-03-21 13:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-03-21 13:56:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

(3 comments)

Hi Maxime, thanks you for reviewing my code.

I think you're not looking at the correct places.
If you look at lines 193 to 200 in orchestrator.py, you will see that I try to use the metrics names instead of the services names (if the current configuration clearly defines a 'metrics' block in metrics.yml).
In the collector, I still try to use the metrics method, and if it can not, I just fall back on the previous code (using the mappings)."}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-03-21 14:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:48:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: Code-Review-1

(13 comments)

I had some issues testing this patch with the gnocchi collector. (see comments)

I also think that this patch  should be split into several parts.

Please add some release notes and documentation about the config format.'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-03-21 18:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

@luka: the line `random.shuffle(self.tenants)` is an optimisation for multi-processor usecase: 
- without this, if you have multi-processors and go straight to the list of tenant, you will checkout every time locked tenants.
- with random, you have more chance to get an unlock tenant at the first time.

This is some old code, Martin just move it.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-03-22 08:04:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

@mcottret thanks, I didn't think about that"}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-04 15:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-04 15:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-05 13:37:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-09 14:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-10 15:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 35.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-11 14:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-04-16 11:35:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 35:

(9 comments)

Many comments, but mostly about typos. My main concern is the get_default_metrics_conf function: I don't think that it should be used for the info controller (see comments).

The second point is that this patch makes all examples in the documentation invalid. The documentation can be updated in another patch, but it should me done soon.

Anyway, thanks a lot for your work :)"}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 36.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-16 15:20:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 36:

Hi Luka, thanks you for reviewing my code. I made some changes as you suggested, about lowercases variables and typos.

I don't think that using default configuration file in the code is an elegant way to do but we do need it in the cloudkitty/api/v1/datamodel/info.py file. I don't know how it works exactly, but sphinx uses some data samples from this file, and these samples are validated by the class itself. This is why I do need a default configuration for building the doc, as we are not copying the metrology configuration file for the tests.

Finally, I centralized the default configuration in a sample file at the root of the code, and import it when needed.

Leaving the sample configuration in the cloudkitty.tests scope will results in a circular import issue, as cloudkitty/api/v1/datamodel/info.py imports cloudkitty/utils.py, which imports the test sample. At this point the code in cloudkitty/tests/__init__.py is executed, which imports cloudkitty/collector/__init__.py which imports cloudkitty/utils.py .
Of course if anyone see a better way to manage this, I'll be glad to implement it!

I rather update the documentation in another patch, if everybody is ok with that."}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-04-17 09:14:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 36:

Hi Martin, 

The info endpoint has a really clumsy design and should be completely reworked (that's indeed why I want to move to it on the processor side)

Can you just add to the release note that the info endpoint will be reworked or removed in the future v2 api ?

Otherwise it's good for me. We will improve the metric yaml format in a following patch."}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-17 09:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 37.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-04-17 09:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

Hi Maxime. Thanks you for reviewing my code! I updated the release note as you suggested.'}, {'account_id': 23173, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:06:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 14:46:13.000000000', 'message': 'Allow Cloudkitty to be used without Openstack:

    * Add a SourceFetcher, which allows to retrieve new type of data sources.
      It allows new collectors to be added.
      (examples: Prometheus, Influxdb, Kubernetes...)

    * Base Cloudkitty on metrics instead of services and resources
      for collecting metrics. This new architecture allows Cloudkitty
      to be more agnostic and so to rate containers metrics as the same way
      as virtual machines metrics.

    * Centralize metrology information in metrics.yml under metrics names.

Task: 6291

commit_message:
Allow Cloudkitty to collect non-OpenStack metrics

* Add a SourceFetcher, which allows to retrieve new type of data sources.
  It allows new collectors to be added.
  (examples: Prometheus, Influxdb, Kubernetes...)

* Base Cloudkitty on metrics instead of services and resources
  for collecting metrics. This new architecture allows Cloudkitty
  to be more agnostic and so to rate containers metrics as the same way
  as virtual machines metrics.

* Centralize metrology information in metrics.yml under metrics names.

Task: 6291
Story: 2001501

Change-Id: I00ca080cf05dfc03a3363720f85b79e003eda9be

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 15:51:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes k8s FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning

This commit fixes FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning under kubectl
node events which is not supposed to appear under default settings
pointed out in the [kubernetes
docs](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/reserve-compute-resources/#enabling-qos-and-pod-level-cgroups).

This is addressed by passing cgroups-per-qos and
enforce-node-allocatable arguments to KUBELET_ARGS when kube worker
nodes are being configured.

Closes-Bug: #1763405

Change-Id: I452840eebb955be9fd178b582be74242e949b662

commit_message:
Fixes k8s FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning

This commit fixes FailedNodeAllocatableEnforcement warning under kubectl
node events which is not supposed to appear under default settings
pointed out in Kubernetes docs:

    https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/reserve-compute-resources/#enabling-qos-and-pod-level-cgroups.

This is addressed by passing cgroups-per-qos and
enforce-node-allocatable arguments to KUBELET_ARGS when kube worker
nodes are being configured.

Closes-Bug: #1763405

Change-Id: I452840eebb955be9fd178b582be74242e949b662

Update converge workflow to remove no-ops

minor update.

Change-Id: I6abe8cba12806730bb3686d4f2695070c85e468a

Add test for conditional delegation

This pattern is used in several openstack-ansible roles to control
if tasks are run on the deploy or target hosts, as chosen by the
deployer

commit_message:
Make specifying the nic optional

If a nic is not specified when setting up a vip resource then
corosync should just do the right thing. This change makes the nic
field optional as there is little benefit in using it.

Change-Id: I022a43df0a50a21df3c5f021dcd563da4d20db53

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 10:00:52.000000000', 'message': "Add libre2 for project-config linting

tox.ini pulls in zuul, but we don't actually install the zuul bindeps.
Zuul has added a requirement on fb-re2 with
Id1b9d7334db78d0f13db33d47a80ffdb65f921df which requires these
libraries.

Change-Id: Ifafdb33752a3bafb5946810878654b0c20d0577c
"}]
commit_message:
Add libre2 for project-config linting

tox.ini pulls in zuul, but we don't actually install the zuul bindeps.
Zuul has added a requirement on fb-re2 with
Id1b9d7334db78d0f13db33d47a80ffdb65f921df which requires these
libraries.

Change-Id: Ifafdb33752a3bafb5946810878654b0c20d0577c

commit_message:
Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966
Change-Id: I8bf80efc04883cd754c19bea0303064080112c6e
(cherry picked from commit f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-04-04 12:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

we need to get this merged and backported for upgrade to work :D'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-05 07:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

> we need to get this merged and backported for upgrade to work :D

ack yeah. we definitely need to converge for upgrade and update and ffwd, though for those last 2 there is no stack update on converge, just updating the plan.

So right now, we would actually rely on the operator to pass this environment file with the usual -e into the "openstack overcloud upgrade converge $params " . I was thinking yesterday about this and whether we should explore doing it like the ffwd-upgrade [1] and update [2] are doing. 

Instead for upgrade converge at least, I thought about using the 'traditional' environment file approach and adding it explicitly in the client like  [3]. If you agree (and it works fine ;) ) then we can tidy up the envs in tht and have one 'known' upgrade-converge.yaml (renamed in this review for example), update-converge.yaml and ffwd-upgrade-converge.yaml

I want to talk about this on scrum today if you're around fyi

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557936/4/tripleo_common/actions/plan.py@508
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558535
[3] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/?id=632269c35cae711819340a616271ba45d608c6b0'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:31:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

i think this is now obsoleted by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559061/ (in particular https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559061/5/environments/lifecycle/ffwd-upgrade-converge.yaml)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Included in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559061/5/environments/lifecycle/ffwd-upgrade-converge.yaml'}]

commit_message:
Revert config-download mappings in upgrade converge step

We need to restore the default mappings for the resources remapped
by config-download during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I6fe16ad01a299a6e1c13138cee3702827708b19f
Depends-On: I6bd4107e8e1a6a9abc38d2dca7a91a6823f8b6c2
Closes-Bug: #1758065

commit_message:
[API] Test set network as not shared where used via RBAC rule

This patch adds test which checks if network can be set as
not shared in case if it is used by some other than owner
project via specified RBAC rule.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561589
Change-Id: Ie483fa1abbe403f28ec56d86e986984902810b05
Related-bug: #1764330

commit_message:
Add a rule to prevent passwords to be logged

Lint rule to make sure no module argument looking like "password"
will get logged.

Change-Id: I180b77faf7aaab57d1c48fc993e43f08c4fb16f6
Closes-Bug: #1760878

subject: bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port
messages: [{'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-04-17 09:55:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-04-17 10:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nsquashed into If26464e889fec94e344f6cb0865274ec22929e80'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 09:55:37.000000000', 'message': 'bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port

The agent extension for bagpipe ML2 was calling do_port_plug_refresh
before having removed the port from internal datastructure, hence
causing the detach_port to be followed by a bogus attach_port.

This change fixes the code and the unit test.

Change-Id: Ie0786855a1e67c163c9710c10e5539aceb56ab08
Closes-Bug: 1764702
'}]
commit_message:
bagpipe ml2: call do_port_plug_refresh *after* unregistering port

The agent extension for bagpipe ML2 was calling do_port_plug_refresh
before having removed the port from internal datastructure, hence
causing the detach_port to be followed by a bogus attach_port.

This change fixes the code and the unit test.

Change-Id: Ie0786855a1e67c163c9710c10e5539aceb56ab08
Closes-Bug: 1764702

messages:

commit_message:
Vagrant: Document the increased Octavia reqs

The default vagrant values are insufficient for running Octavia
amphorae. This patch addresses it in documentation.

Change-Id: If0147adb39793b4601f7b00bec34aa9d593ecbc4
Closes-Bug: 1708173
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
tests: don't configure plugin for tests that don't need it

Except test_subnet, there are no more object tests that would require
the plugin configured, so let's not go through the hassle of setting it
up. (For the record, this setup was not needed since
If1252c42c49cd59dba7ec7c02c9b887fdc169f51).

commit_message:
Fix the kuryr group missing for inventory file

Now, the kuryr is missing in inventory file, it will result in the
kuryr role just can run in compute group[0], the ps to fix it.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/kuryr/defaults/main.yml#L14

Change-Id: I4b1b20bb4a3640327fddbe704f2b721ae45f2b6d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 13:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'Change clients_keystone/auth_uri default to public Keystone URL

By default, the ::heat class configures clients_keystone/auth_uri to the
value of ::heat::keystone::authtoken::auth_url, which is generally the
admin endpoint on port 35357.

However, since this URI can be used by non-admin clients running inside
instances, such as os-collect-config, a better default value would be to
use either the public or internal Keystone endpoint, depending on the
deployment. This commit changes the default to the public Keystone
endpoint defined in ::heat::keystone::authtoken::www_authenticate_uri.

It is still possible to provide a custom value using the
heat_clients_keystone_uri parameter.

Change-Id: Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b
Closes-Bug: #1763700
'}, {'created': '2018-04-14 15:31:14.000000000', 'message': 'Change clients_keystone/auth_uri default to public Keystone URL

By default, the ::heat class configures clients_keystone/auth_uri to the
value of ::heat::keystone::authtoken::auth_url, which is generally the
admin endpoint on port 35357.

However, since this URI can be used by non-admin clients running inside
instances, such as os-collect-config, a better default value would be to
use either the public or internal Keystone endpoint, depending on the
deployment. This commit changes the default to the public Keystone
endpoint defined in ::heat::keystone::authtoken::www_authenticate_uri.

It is still possible to provide a custom value using the
heat_clients_keystone_uri parameter.

Change-Id: Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b
Closes-Bug: #1763700
'}]
commit_message:
Change clients_keystone/auth_uri default to public Keystone URL

By default, the ::heat class configures clients_keystone/auth_uri to the
value of ::heat::keystone::authtoken::auth_url, which is generally the
admin endpoint on port 35357.

However, since this URI can be used by non-admin clients running inside
instances, such as os-collect-config, a better default value would be to
use either the public or internal Keystone endpoint, depending on the
deployment. This commit changes the default to the public Keystone
endpoint defined in ::heat::keystone::authtoken::www_authenticate_uri.

It is still possible to provide a custom value using the
heat_clients_keystone_uri parameter.

Change-Id: Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b
Closes-Bug: #1763700

commit_message:
Update docs job info to match current PTI

Our doc requirements have been updated to run documentation builds
using sphinx-build instead of calling tox. The PTI reference for
Python code still contained old recommendations to use
[build_sphinx] in setup.cfg. This updates this Python recommendation
to match what is stated in the full PTI with additions for making
local runs easier through using tox.

Change-Id: Ibdaeefdac6b6bbeef544778d2fa5c3972d180cb8
