[{'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-04-09 08:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-04-09 14:34:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think it's technically under the puppet openstack umbrella (like puppet-ceph).  That being said, tripleo does leverage it more than puppet-openstack but I guess we should figure out if we should move it."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-04-09 16:46:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think that we've ever really considered it under puppet-openstack.  It doesn't actually even share the same Puppet OpenStack cores either. It's kindof it's own thing at the moment.  We don't even test it in puppet-openstack-integration?

I'm not opposed to it but I think its better to sit under TripleO as it's (primary) consumer is TripleO"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-04-09 16:52:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Ok fair enough.  I thought it was, but that's fine if it is under tripleo.  We don't test it with p-o-i because we don't configure pacemaker in any of the Puppet Openstack bits."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-09 18:55:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-10 08:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-10 14:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-04-10 17:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

If the puppet and tripleo people agree, then cool.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-11 13:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-08 07:13:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add puppet-senlin to Puppet OpenStack

"Senlin is a clustering service for OpenStack clouds. It creates and operates
clusters of homogeneous objects exposed by other OpenStack services. The goal
is to make the orchestration of collections of similar objects easier.

Senlin provides RESTful APIs to users so that they can associate various
policies to a cluster.  Sample policies include placement policy, load
balancing policy, health policy, scaling policy, update policy and so on.

Senlin is designed to be capable of managing different types of objects. An
object's lifecycle is managed using profile type implementations, which are
themselves plugins."

More information about Senlin project:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Senlin

We started to work on the Puppet senlin module that installs and
configures Senlin services.

Change-Id: I53b62c6874da44215a89b56f57c44f954aeab057
Depends-On: Ic4272d28016b95006f6c31c41f60c9111ebb2c91

commit_message:
Add puppet-senlin to Puppet OpenStack

"Senlin is a clustering service for OpenStack clouds. It creates and operates
clusters of homogeneous objects exposed by other OpenStack services. The
goal is to make the orchestration of collections of similar objects easier.

Senlin provides RESTful APIs to users so that they can associate various
policies to a cluster.  Sample policies include placement policy, load
balancing policy, health policy, scaling policy, update policy and so on.

Senlin is designed to be capable of managing different types of objects. An
object's lifecycle is managed using profile type implementations, which are
themselves plugins."

More information about Senlin project:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Senlin

We started to work on the Puppet senlin module that installs and
configures Senlin services.

Change-Id: I53b62c6874da44215a89b56f57c44f954aeab057
Depends-On: Ic4272d28016b95006f6c31c41f60c9111ebb2c91

messages: [{'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nhttps://review.openstack.org/#/c/561825/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 07:32:12.000000000', 'message': "unbreak unit tests: pecan.jsonify 1.3 adjustment

From pecan 1.3, pecan.jsonify uses json.Encoder unconditionally so that
jsonifying mock fails.
Pecan 1.2 uses simplejosn.Encoder as encoder which accidentally encodes
MagicMock as {} due to check of '_asdict' attributes.
Since pecan.jsonify uses __json__ magic method when it's defined,
add __json__ method to mocks to return {} as json encode.

Change-Id: I07ad74142ad781a079dc5c9cac0f21ca42b5c59a
"}]
commit_message:
unbreak unit tests: pecan.jsonify 1.3 adjustment

From pecan 1.3, pecan.jsonify uses json.Encoder unconditionally so that
jsonifying mock fails.
Pecan 1.2 uses simplejosn.Encoder as encoder which accidentally encodes
MagicMock as {} due to check of '_asdict' attributes.
Since pecan.jsonify uses __json__ magic method when it's defined,
add __json__ method to mocks to return {} as json encode.

Change-Id: I07ad74142ad781a079dc5c9cac0f21ca42b5c59a

commit_message:

The change adds dimension key/value pairs to the list of associated
metrics in Alarm Details section of Alarm History view. Without this

commit_message:
Add functional tests for Neutron DNS extension

Since with [0] we now support setting DNS domain and name attributes for
floating IPs, add them to the functional test.

Enable the neutron-dns service for the functional tests.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/558820

Change-Id: Ie856e275a1bde03d70a8c3391593e987743d45fe

'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 11:37:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ContainerBroker.empty()

'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 18:47:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ContainerBroker.empty()

Previously ContainerBroker.empty did not check the contents of the

shard range when considering shard range object counts.

Change-Id: I5b77e54c9ce2b6546feacbe856bf944a18f9b29d
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 12:33:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ContainerBroker.empty()

Previously ContainerBroker.empty did not check the contents of the
fresh db for misplaced objects when in sharded state, and did not
consider the content of a retiring db while sharding. Consequently it
was possible to delete a sharding container, or a sharded container
with only misplaced objects.

Own shard range was also erroneously included when considering shard
range object counts.

Now the method checks that both fresh and any retiring db are empty
and that there is zero shard range usage.

Change-Id: I5b77e54c9ce2b6546feacbe856bf944a18f9b29d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ContainerBroker.empty()

Previously ContainerBroker.empty did not check the contents of the
fresh db for misplaced objects when in sharded state, and did not
consider the content of a retiring db while sharding. Consequently it
was possible to delete a sharding container, or a sharded container
with only misplaced objects.

Own shard range was also erroneously included when considering shard
range object counts.

Now the method checks that both fresh and any retiring db are empty
and that there is zero shard range usage.

Change-Id: I5b77e54c9ce2b6546feacbe856bf944a18f9b29d

We also have a couple of jobs that stay in this repo.

I don't understand how just moving one-to-one into repo will help you get this working.

(will read #openstack-infra later)"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If you migrate in-tree, remember that legacy jobs should be imported *completely* with renaming - your current change does not import the playbooks and neither renames.

Please review the docs and tell me how you want to continue."}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:35:19.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Thanks for you guidance.

What I'll do is first fix n8g-bgpvpn CI by removing n8g-odl from required-projects in project-config (see Ia2154742e9a5a214ff2a59f3035bba3ed790f5f9), and later work on the migration per se."}]

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Amend lower constraints according to tools/fix-lower-constraints.py and
removed qpid-python from requirements.txt to fix requirements job.

Change-Id: I47d55fc608ae9890eeb6022aa445b304e0a1b95b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use 'none' auth plugin

since keystoneauth 3.0.0 there is a proper 'none' auth plugin to
use for standalone services deployed w/o Keystone support.

Use this plugin instead of 'admin_token' for auth_type specified as
variants of 'None'.

Change-Id: I425f03574858dd582118d5544381af703134da72

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic1f4de4b5f36cfe5bd5e578507e320918d1078f9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]

[{'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2018-04-16 07:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2018-04-16 09:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bz_1313507 to live-migration_port_range'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-04-16 12:02:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think we can change the default range in puppet-nova. It would cause problems for users that have firewalls configured using 49152-49215 range.
We could change the default range used in tripleo though, as it sets up the firewall too."}, {'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2018-04-17 05:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The required change is done in tripleo-heat-templates, I2039eca87c11638faf6262259b7bcface982f5c6'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 07:54:24.000000000', 'message': "Modify libvirt port range for live-migration

By default, libvirtd uses ports 49152 to 49215 for live-migration,
as specified in qemu.conf

Since these ports is subset to ephemeral port range, which is from
32768 to 61000 for linux, it can be consumed by any other service
as well. It causes live-migration to fail, with below error:

Live Migration failure: internal error: Unable to find an unused
port in range 'migration' (49152-49215)

Moved the default port range out of ephemeral port range, so that
it can be consumed only for live-migration by libvirtd.

Change-Id: I4834743d8eeb53fe87ea797cbcdb1c5a5b04101f
"}]
commit_message:
Modify libvirt port range for live-migration

By default, libvirtd uses ports 49152 to 49215 for live-migration,
as specified in qemu.conf

Since these ports is subset to ephemeral port range, which is from
32768 to 61000 for linux, it can be consumed by any other service
as well. It causes live-migration to fail, with below error:

Live Migration failure: internal error: Unable to find an unused
port in range 'migration' (49152-49215)

Moved the default port range out of ephemeral port range, so that
it can be consumed only for live-migration by libvirtd.

Change-Id: I4834743d8eeb53fe87ea797cbcdb1c5a5b04101f

commit_message:
Fix backwards incompatibility with auth_uri

Idb0f408776ef27f16a522e4443531fd97276669b switches to use
www_authenticate_uri but it is not backwards incompatible for folks who
have yet to switch to use www_authenticate_uri. We should still support
auth_uri for the time beaing.

Change-Id: I132fa8ebf91e932cd7fbc610dccd332348d52d49
Closes-Bug: #1764598

Make and use a utility class so that the code is easier to read.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 18:55:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add deadlock retry decorator to gc_by_engine

gc_by_engine calls _mark_failed. Because _mark_failed performs
deletions, it can potentially deadlock.

action_mark_failed also calls _mark_failed and is already protected
using deadlock retry decorator.

This change adds the deadlock retry decorator to gc_by_engine to prevent
potential deadlocks.

Change-Id: Iaf00a5cbb56cac9ab08d601e69924e8a7974486f
'}]
commit_message:
Add deadlock retry decorator to gc_by_engine

gc_by_engine calls _mark_failed. Because _mark_failed performs
deletions, it can potentially deadlock.

action_mark_failed also calls _mark_failed and is already protected
using deadlock retry decorator.

This change adds the deadlock retry decorator to gc_by_engine to prevent
potential deadlocks.

Change-Id: Iaf00a5cbb56cac9ab08d601e69924e8a7974486f

If Public TLS is enabled, non-TLS requests made to the public IP are
redirected to use TLS. This is fine for most cases but are quite
problematic when we're in the process of moving to TLS by default. So
I'm disabling this while the tripleo-common [1] and the t-h-t [2]

commit_message:
Temporarily disable redirection with TLS

If Public TLS is enabled, non-TLS requests made to the public IP are
redirected to use TLS. This is fine for most cases but are quite
problematic when we're in the process of moving to TLS by default. So
I'm disabling this while the tripleo-common [1] and the t-h-t [2]
changes that enable TLS by default merge.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554926/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558424/

Change-Id: I2a0cdb483203cfeaaa64cc0f51d95d268fb99d32

commit_message:
HAProxy: Redirect to TLS port

The way we did redirection, we got everything coming to the public IP
and redirected the connection to use TLS. This didn't take into account
that the port might change when using TLS. So this fixes that. This is
specially useful when using only the ctlplane network (multinode jobs),
since the public IP is the same as the rest.

Change-Id: I4f25c6293eb5ff75707c5f1e48670c83138e809a

commit_message:
Re-enable redirection based on TLS

reflected by the dependencies of this patch.

This version of RYU doesn't import from pip which causes
problems with pip 10.

commit_message:
RabbitMQ: recover from full cluster restart

This PS updates the RabbitMQ chart to name nodes via their hostnames
rather than IPs - allowing the cluster (and single nodes) to be
restarted without impact.

Additionally the rabbitmq managment interface is exposed and basic
helm tests have been added.

Change-Id: I84857d9f3697eaa8491aafaf6ee3b9d47dbf2191

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 13157, 'name': 'Zhao Chao', 'email': 'zhaochao1984@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhaochao'}, {'_account_id': 16006, 'name': 'goldyfruit', 'email': 'gaetan.trellu@incloudus.com', 'username': 'goldyfruit'}, {'_account_id': 18665, 'name': 'Pierre Blanc', 'email': 'pierreblanc75@gmail.com', 'username': 'pblanc'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24739, 'name': 'Yao Wang', 'email': 'wangyao@cmss.chinamobile.com', 'username': 'wangyao'}, {'_account_id': 24791, 'name': 'Maciej Jozefczyk', 'email': 'jeicam.pl@gmail.com', 'username': 'maciej.jozefczyk'}, {'_account_id': 25113, 'name': 'Fan Zhang', 'email': 'zh.f@outlook.com', 'username': 'fanzhang'}, {'_account_id': 26895, 'name': 'Luke Browning', 'email': 'lukebrowning@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'lukebrowning'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-18 22:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-18 23:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-19 05:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Guestagent should not run as root, normally people may run guestagent under the 'trove' user(created at deployment, or by packaging management system), so the secrets of the admin database user (i.e. "os_admin") used by guestagent will be saved to ~trove/.my.cnf (normally /home/trove/.my.cnf), so the change made in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526728/ should not affect the existing deployments most of the time.

However this may cause problems for the depoyments which are running guestagent under root as the secret of the database user 'os_admin' is overriden by 'root@localhost', if this is true, most operations by guestagent could not complete. Hi, Geatan Trellu, could you double check this problem?

And it looks like not neccessary to save this 'root@localhost' secrets to an plain text file, and not secure. So I think we could just revert this part? @Luke Browning'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-19 18:53:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Zhao I confirmed that when Trove guest agent is running as simple user we don't have this issue.

I confirmed too that when Trove guest agent is running as root user, the replication is not working because of the overriden /root/.my.cnf by root@localhost."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-20 13:07:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> @Zhao I confirmed that when Trove guest agent is running as simple
 > user we don't have this issue.
 > 
 > I confirmed too that when Trove guest agent is running as root
 > user, the replication is not working because of the overriden
 > /root/.my.cnf by root@localhost.

@Gaetan, thanks for testing and reporting this. Then I suggest it's better to revert this part of change in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526728/, as what I said in my last comment, it seems there is no need to save this to a file and not secure.

I'll add @Luke Browning to the reviewer list, hoping he has time to help review on this."}, {'account_id': 24739, 'date': '2018-01-20 14:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-20 23:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-20 23:21:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't understand your comment that the root credential is overriding os_admin. They are separate accounts.  Each has its own password in the database.  It is either accessed as root or os_admin, not both."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-21 03:28:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't understand your comment that the root credential is
 > overriding os_admin. They are separate accounts.  Each has its own
 > password in the database.  It is either accessed as root or
 > os_admin, not both.

Hi, Luke, I may not express clearly. Yes, 'os_admin' and 'root' are referring to the database user, and the are different. But the problem is when guestagent is running as root (this is the system user), it will fetch the credential information from the '.my.cnf' under the home dir of root (that is /root/.my.cnf), this file will be overridden by the change in _generate_root_password in the previous patch(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526728/). Of course, as I stated in my first comment, this should not cause problems when guestagent is running as any other unprivileged user(normally people will use the 'trove' system user in the guest vm).

So this may not a very serious problem most of the time, but I found it seems not neccessary and secure to save the 'root' database user credential informations to a plain text file while guestagent will always use the 'os_admin' user."}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-21 21:42:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Zhao,

The trove-guestagent is supposed to be run as ubuntu, not root.

I added the logic to save the root password to /root/.my.cnf, because the 
invocation of mysqladmin fails when it is invoked via sudo during the
preparation stage in the replication slave.  The database is replicated
from the parent, so the database has accounts and passwords for root
and os_admin.

This code was failing in mysql 5.7, because a security enhancement was
made that required the root password to be used if the root account had
a password.  In 5.6, it succeeded by virtue of being run as root, no
password was required.  In 5.7, the password is required.

Note the traceback for mysqladmin says root@localhost, not root@127.0.0.1.
Changing the data in the file to 127.0.0.1, may work, but it is probably not
necessary, since the documentation indicates that the three local host 
names (includes ip6) are synonomous.  

In any case, the file /root/.my_root.cnf is not documented.  The documentation
does identify /root/.mylogin.cnf which it says is only applied for client use 
only.  This should include mysqladmin running locally, but needs to be tested.

So if you are running the guest agent as root, that is probably the 
problem.  There is code that looks up os_admin password I believe as ~/my.cnf,
which would access the same file.

I don't know why you are running the guestagent as root.  I believe that is an
invalid configuration, but saving the root's password to /root/.mylogin.cnf
and os_admin's password to /root/.my.cnf might work provided that .mylogin.cnf
file takes precedence over .my.cnf.

Anyway that is kind of a kludge but I wouldn't be opposed to that.

But the real question is why run trove-guestagent as root?  Can you run it as
the ubuntu user or some other user.  Note the guestagent is run as the guest user
account in the elements.  It is not intended to be root."}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-21 21:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I just re-read your comment and it appears that you understand that trove is not expecting the guest agent to be run as root.  

So the reason to save the root password to the file is that it is needed
by mysqladmin which is invoked by the guest agent as 

            out, err = utils.execute_with_timeout(
                "/usr/bin/mysqladmin",
                "ping", run_as_root=True, root_helper="sudo",
                log_output_on_error=True)

There is no command argument for root's password.  Using the file 
is the easiest way to solve this problem as the root password is
created during the prepare stage before os_admin is created. 

The mysqladmin command is expecting to be run as root, not os_admin,
but maybe the suggestion that I made to use both .my.cnf and .mylogin.cnf will work.'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-22 00:58:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Alternatively, you could save the os_admin password in ~/.os_admin.cnf.  This would not be tied into mysql directly, but it doesn't need to be as the os_admin commands are done through the guest agent via python. There are no database commands run as os_admin.  They as root via sudo."}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-22 14:59:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Guys,

Thanks for your investigations, really appreciate !

We had to use root system user for some internal security reasons, this is how we discovered this behavior. We perfectly understand that normally the guest agent as to be run under a regular system user.

@luke, we really like the idea of .mylogin.cnf file in /root/ directory.

We will do some tests on Debian/RedHat like distributions with your suggestion to make sure it doesn't break anything."}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-23 22:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

After some lectures about .mylogin.cnf, it seems that this file should be used only for encrypted password generated by the mysql_config_editor command.'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-23 23:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Gaetan, I actually like the alternative solution better.   Save os_admin password to ~/.os_admin.cnf.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-23 23:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Luke, the os_admin user is used by innobackupex to perform replication and backup.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-24 01:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> @Gaetan, I actually like the alternative solution better.   Save
 > os_admin password to ~/.os_admin.cnf.
Agree, This may be a simpler solution.

 > @Luke, the os_admin user is used by innobackupex to perform
 > replication and backup.
@Gaetan, this should be fine. innobackupex use the same way as mysql datastore service to get the auth password, see:
https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py#L628
https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/strategies/backup/mysql_impl.py#L53-L56

If the default os_admin credential file location changed in mysql datastore service, innobackup should also works well.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-24 16:01:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Zhao, ADMIN_USER_NAME is equal to "os_admin".
https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py#L52'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-25 01:35:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> @Zhao, ADMIN_USER_NAME is equal to "os_admin".
 > https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py#L52

Yes, Gaetan, but this should be fine. Guestagent fetch the password of ADMIN_USER_NAME by 'get_auth_password'[1], which in turn calls 'get_client_auth_file'[2]. The default credential file of ADMIN_USER_NAME is hard-coded in 'get_get_client_auth_file', so it could be changed without breaks other things, and may be better to add another constant for the name of this file.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py#L628
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py#L644'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-25 18:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Correct.  That is what I was advocating.

def get_client_auth_file(self):
        return guestagent_utils.build_file_path("~", ".os_admin.cnf")'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-25 18:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Luke @Zhao, I will run some tests.
Thanks'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-25 19:05:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Please try mysql, mariadb, and percona.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Zhao, I created a new constant for the file.

I had to add the "--host" option to InnoBackupEx and MySQLDump classes because all the connection are made using "localhost" instead of "127.0.0.1"

Tested on MySQL 5.7, MariaDB 10.1 and Percona 5.6 for backup and replication.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-27 01:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18665, 'date': '2018-01-27 16:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

@Gaetan, check the tox logs, you have to update 10 tests.
grep "Failed 10 tests - output below:" on http://logs.openstack.org/98/535498/5/check/openstack-tox-py27/b679efc/job-output.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-27 19:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Gaetan, I would like to understand why running the trove guest agent as root is required by your company.  How is this beneficial to others?  Is it your intent to change other databases also or does this just apply to mysql. I believe you can change the guest account under which the trove guest agent is run to anything but root, so there is flexibility in the mechanism.  This is a big change architecturally and running as root is not tested by the integration tests or gate tests.  Please tell us why this change is desirable.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-29 17:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-29 18:02:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@Luke we tried all datastores (except DB2 for now) as root and it's the only issue that we had.

We are using root user internally when sudoers is too permissive (it avoids us to monitor multiple users)."}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-29 18:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-30 00:52:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-30 01:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Besides the inline comments, I think we need a release note for this change. The reason is we changes the localtion of the mysql/mariadb/percona admin user credential file, this change should be fine for newly built images, but for the people who want to update guestagent of the existing images, an extra step should be taken (i.e. rename ~/.my.cnf to ~/.os_admin.cnf). So we may also need a "UpgradeImpact" line in the commit message too (and the upgrade release node).'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-30 17:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Zhao, thanks for your help !

There is a slightly difference between localhost and 127.0.0.1, by default localhost looks for a socket when 127.0.0.1 looks for a TCP connection[1].

There is a way to make sure that all connections are initialize via TCP, it's to add the "protocol = tcp" under the [client] section within /etc/mysql/my.cnf

You are completely right about the upgrade process, I'll dig on that.

[1] https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/connecting.html#option_general_protocol'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-30 19:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-30 20:47:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@Zhao, You right about the commit message, I'll update it.

Everything was working fine as root before this commit: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526728/9/trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql_common/service.py

If you think it doesn't worth it to continue, we can abandon the change."}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-01-30 23:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

In my opinion you should abandon this change.  We are weeks away from completing this release.  What you are suggesting here is really a new feature.  That is, in general, contrary to most security best practices to run everything as root.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-31 02:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> @Zhao, thanks for your help !
 > 
 > There is a slightly difference between localhost and 127.0.0.1, by
 > default localhost looks for a socket when 127.0.0.1 looks for a TCP
 > connection[1].
 > 
 > There is a way to make sure that all connections are initialize via
 > TCP, it's to add the "protocol = tcp" under the [client] section
 > within /etc/mysql/my.cnf
 > 
 > You are completely right about the upgrade process, I'll dig on
 > that.
 > 
 > [1] https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/connecting.html#option_general_protocol

@Geatan, Thanks for providing the mysql referrence about client protocol, I didn't read about that. However the reason for changing from 'localhost' to '127.0.0.1' is still not clear, if using 'localhost' by default just like before causes problems, an note should be added to explain the actual reason. In fact, if using the default 'localhost', there must be another bug, I think.



 > In my opinion you should abandon this change.  We are weeks away
 > from completing this release.  What you are suggesting here is
 > really a new feature.  That is, in general, contrary to most
 > security best practices to run everything as root.

In fact I would like to see this patch getting merged, however @Luke is right about the release cycle and that this is a new feature which also affecting the project security. I hope this patch could keep being updated for merge. If we cannot make the merging happen in the current release cycle, we could leave it to the next one.

@Geatan, thanks for working on this problem. I think it would be great to solve problems people found in their deployments of Trove and in the same time, make Trove itself better.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-31 14:20:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@Zhao, @Luke, I'll let this change open until the next release.
Thanks for your help and your time, really appreciate !"}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-01 00:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-01 16:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-02-05 20:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I vote for postpone it'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-02-09 00:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-04-17 02:20:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi, Gaetan Trellu, are you still planning to finish this patch?'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-04-17 02:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hey Fan, yes I will!'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-04-17 02:27:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

[{'created': '2018-01-18 22:05:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MySQL/MariaDB/Percona broken replication

The MySQL/MariaDB/Percona replication doesn't work anymore
since this review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526728/

The way how the replication is created is by using "os_admin" user
via innobackupex command. The previous commit override /root/.my.cnf
with the "os_admin" credential by the "root" credentials.

The way to preserve the "root" credentials without overriding the
"os_admin" credentials is to change the "/root/.my.cnf/ path
to "/root/.my_root.cnf".

Change-Id: I7f4cc215721ad5951c40669428ac3dbc836d20bc

commit_message:
Fix MySQL/MariaDB/Percona broken replication

The MySQL/MariaDB/Percona replication doesn't work anymore
since this review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526728/

The way how the replication is created is by using "os_admin" user
via innobackupex command. The previous commit override /root/.my.cnf
with the "os_admin" credential by the "root" credentials.

The way to preserve the "root" credentials without overriding the
"os_admin" credentials is to change the "/root/.my.cnf/ path
to "/root/.my_root.cnf".

Change-Id: I7f4cc215721ad5951c40669428ac3dbc836d20bc
Closes-Bug: #1744165

commit_message:
Add quotas panel for admin

This patch adds quotas table view for admin user.

To enable quotas panel, copy followings into horizon's
openstack_dashboard/local/enabled directory.

magnum_ui/enabled/_2370_admin_container_infra_panel_group.py
magnum_ui/enabled/_2371_admin_container_infra_quotas_panel.py

Change-Id: I2ae154ef15f537451c46ec46cab1ee9cb3ceef6c
Partial-Implements: blueprint add-quotas-panel

subject: Delete old package when updating function
messages:
[{'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-04-16 08:27:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-04-16 09:23:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Overall is good, only a couple of minor comments inline.

I also noticed that we don't handle those functions with None md5sum (ones that created with previous versions of qinling) well. They won't be deleted from the storage even with this change. It might not be a big deal as qinling is now not very widely deployed yet. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-04-16 12:15:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> They won't be deleted from the storage even with this change. It
 > might not be a big deal as qinling is now not very widely deployed
 > yet. What do you think?

Yeah, not having historical baggage is the advantage of the young project, it's not necessary to put much restrict to our implementation so that the project could move fast."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-04-16 12:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-04-17 01:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 05:02:29.000000000', 'message': 'Reproduce navigations

Details view does not reproduce side menu and breadcrumb properly

commit_message:
Install Horizon from git repository in tox test

To test UI plugins, we should install recent Horizon
from master branch.

Also, fixed eslint and karma.

To run tox test easily before upload patchset,
adds eslint, karma, docs and releasenotes to envlist.

Change-Id: I82806631e7219eaa2372c2cd62b264056fbea64d

commit_message:
Install Horizon from git repository in tox test

To test UI plugins, we should install recent Horizon
from master branch.

Also, fixed eslint and karma.

To run tox test easily before upload patchset,
adds eslint, karma, docs and releasenotes to envlist.

Change-Id: Ieb53598390f81ca684106f369b5e3bc175c6754e

commit_message:
Install python2 version of psutil

Use this so we get the python2 version of this library, which is
currently required by the peakmem tracker, which runs underneath
python2

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/561526
Change-Id: I7b2cd41cbff9edc03b84b645a42364d147561565

commit_message:
Allow to pin ubuntu version rather than current

This allow users to specify a version of the ubuntu build that
diskimagebuilder will use.

Change-Id: Ia89ca3558ee9fd980a3145592b8703405fc29745

commit_message:
Load custom drivers from config option

This commit adds support to load custom driver endpoints from config file.
New option 'custom_driver_endpoints' is added for the same.

Eg: custom_driver_endpoints = 'test=congress.datasources.test_driver:TestDriver'

Implements blueprint enable-drivers-by-default

Change-Id: I465301213734b9d4d7e5f7d67bae1d08767d9f16

[{'created': '2018-04-09 23:45:03.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface

When l3 agent is restarted on a dvr_snat node that is configured
for L3_HA and has a centralized FloatingIP configured to the
qg-interface in the snat_namespace, that FloatingIP is not
re-configured to the qg-interface when agent starts.

The reason being, the cidr is not being retrieved from the
keepalived instance and only retrieved from the
centralized_fip_cidr_set.

If 'L3_HA' is configured we need to retrieve it from the keepalived
instance.

This patch fixes the problem by retrieving the cidrs from the
keepalived instance for the qg-interface.

Change-Id: I848a20d06e2d344503a4cb1776dbe2617d91bc41
Closes-Bug: #1740450
(cherry picked from commit 64028a389ff904f15e471b44bd5b3979c5db2cd2)
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Restarting l3 agent loses centralized fip ip on qg-interface

When l3 agent is restarted on a dvr_snat node that is configured
for L3_HA and has a centralized FloatingIP configured to the
qg-interface in the snat_namespace, that FloatingIP is not
re-configured to the qg-interface when agent starts.

The reason being, the cidr is not being retrieved from the
keepalived instance and only retrieved from the
centralized_fip_cidr_set.

If 'L3_HA' is configured we need to retrieve it from the keepalived
instance.

This patch fixes the problem by retrieving the cidrs from the
keepalived instance for the qg-interface.

Change-Id: I848a20d06e2d344503a4cb1776dbe2617d91bc41
Closes-Bug: #1740450
(cherry picked from commit 64028a389ff904f15e471b44bd5b3979c5db2cd2)

commit_message:
Remove RequestContext.instance_lock_checked

This was initially added in change I1127e31d86a061a93a64ee1eb4a4d900d8bf49b5
but is no longer used anywhere in nova since change
Ic18017a16c5bffee85a43db65ff17283599a27ba.

Anyway, this change still allows it to be passed as a kwarg for now but will
emit a UserWarning if it is, and then we can make it a hard failure starting
in the S release.

Change-Id: Ib0b23a47c2e833073108af6700b16f8026631a83

commit_message:
Add detail to README.md about how Ceilometer mapped to Mon API

Fill in some examples and detail about which files configure
the mapping behavior.

Add a boolean and a condition to support upgrades to a containerized

In the future, we'll have one command but we're not there yet (until

Change-Id: I726f63aeb1499709cd2c5da206943c7246dc54d3
"}]
commit_message:
Support containerized undercloud upgrade

Add a boolean and a condition to support upgrades to a containerized
undercloud.
In the future, we'll have one command but we're not there yet (until
it's default).

Change-Id: I726f63aeb1499709cd2c5da206943c7246dc54d3

[{'created': '2018-04-13 16:58:48.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip"

This reverts commit 4c7ca4cbc385fa70438015ebc91b8692c00d46e7.

The reverted commit made it such that you can not set a
hostname as undercloud_public_host in undercloud.conf. This
is required so that the UI can be accessed by hostname
externally as well as to make the Undercloud API accessible
externally.


Change-Id: I57eeb2dd26336465627593d633c63b92da42e71d
Closes-Bug: #1763776
'}, {'created': '2018-04-15 17:54:19.000000000', 'message': 'Partially revert "Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip"

This reverts the manifests/haproxy.pp parts of
commit 4c7ca4cbc385fa70438015ebc91b8692c00d46e7.

The reverted commit made it such that you can not set a
hostname as undercloud_public_host in undercloud.conf. This
is required so that the UI can be accessed by hostname
externally as well as to make the Undercloud API accessible
externally. We keep the parts of that change that verify if
the haproxy VIP for pacemaker is a proper IP as it can
happen that a misconfigured network template causes empty
strings and the deploy will fail in a very odd way.

Change-Id: I57eeb2dd26336465627593d633c63b92da42e71d
Closes-Bug: #1763776
'}]
commit_message:
Partially revert "Fail more gracefully when passed an empty ip"

This reverts the manifests/haproxy.pp parts of
commit 4c7ca4cbc385fa70438015ebc91b8692c00d46e7.

The reverted commit made it such that you can not set a
hostname as undercloud_public_host in undercloud.conf. This
is required so that the UI can be accessed by hostname
externally as well as to make the Undercloud API accessible
externally. We keep the parts of that change that verify if
the haproxy VIP for pacemaker is a proper IP as it can
happen that a misconfigured network template causes empty
strings and the deploy will fail in a very odd way.

Change-Id: I57eeb2dd26336465627593d633c63b92da42e71d
Closes-Bug: #1763776

commit_message:
Ensure pep8 is present before trying to proceed

All evidence appears to be that pep8 is disappearing
for some unknown reason, except only in the grenade job
triggered by ironic for Queens to Rocky.

Story: #2001853
Task: #14303
Change-Id: I70f50584a7552e294681375e42879f68750f5096

subject: Release OpenStack-Ansible queens/17.0.2
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-13 17:42:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-13 17:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to release_osa'}, {'account_id': 21561, 'date': '2018-04-13 18:44:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can you give more details on the Octavia dashboard support? Wondering if it's enough of a feature to warrant a 17.1.0?"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-13 19:28:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Can you give more details on the Octavia dashboard support?
 > Wondering if it's enough of a feature to warrant a 17.1.0?

We'd bump the minor (i.e. 17.1.0) if there is a change in the deployer (our users) interface.

Octavia could be deployed in the past but the dashboard was not automatically wired, and was pulled in all the deploys. In this, we made sure not everyone is getting that octavia dashboard. Therefore the octavia part is more of a bug fix than a new feature (it follows the same process as the other dashboards now).

Hope it clarifies it!"}, {'account_id': 21561, 'date': '2018-04-13 20:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Makes sense! LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-04-14 15:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM and the deliverable does not assert that it follows the stable policy so we can go ahead and tag it when the PyPI situation settles down.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-16 22:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Allow vhost socket directory user/group as configurable from template

For ovs2.8 version, it is required to modify the vhost socket directory
permissions as openvswitch:hugetlbfs instead of the earlier hardcoded
values qemu:qemu. Making these values as input which could be configured
from templates.

Change-Id: Ia2d0a49567f51b8e6ecdf1967c515ef0dfe81567
(cherry picked from commit 361785f14d9965b0f81706dfbe3a01550a110b1a)

commit_message:
Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130
(cherry picked from commit db081a75c5d2b7a99b4b796f9de7a4aadd7ab522)
(cherry picked from commit 08a0f081bf627ef09b934b2cc1dc66e172a1dbd4)

commit_message:
Don't merge repo changes from different branches

when using reproducer script and cloning repos with changes,
ignore those changes that are coming from different branches.
It filters out backported dependencies if they are in ZUUL_CHANGES

Change-Id: If525e3db07976cd8d010074b22129ccec9dd09f7

commit_message:
Add tripleo-upgrade vars into featureset047.

Variables use_oooq and tripleo_ci are needed
to be set if we want to use the tripleo-upgrade
rol in upstream CI.

commit_message:
Eliminate Scan-Done sysmeta

The scan-done sysmeta is not required since the same info can be
inferred from the shard range table. Also refactor _cleave and change
return value to avoid confusion i.e. return indicates when *all*
cleaving is complete.

Store cleaving_context progress as each chard range is cleaved rather
than at end of a batch.

Change-Id: I90be4ada8fefbf3dda12fdf5dca46fb405a95a6a

zuul website, and so needs to use this job.

Also fix a typo.

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints to make them match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I1a01264d7f69a041a106813e3ad33577d2757564
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

List instances performace optimization

Join service table for microversion starting 2.16 only
so only include service from 2.16 version.

Co-Authored-By: jichenjc <jichenjc@cn.ibm.com>

Closes-Bug: 1719460

Change-Id: I6c57fa013ee8f6d064fc747906e1234a0aa3e8c2

commit_message:
Add SUSE's zypper example alongside yum and apt

The instalation docs all support SUSE versions, and the
openstackclient installation instructions goes to the effort
of giving an example with 'apt' and 'yum' so add 'zypper' as
well in case someone in the training is running OpenSUSE, SLES
or SLED.

The patch slightly re-arranges the slide to get all the
package managers on 1 slide. We could try and rearrange and
simple add more slides.

Disclaimer, SUSE is my employer and saw it was missing, so
this is a drive by change.

Change-Id: Ieb5e43e937c51c4b7cbd845ee1520f9fecb8a5c1

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,

commit_message:
Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

Change-Id: I0fa3934b345d51de85fd9d8a5a211b8e1bc50d86
(cherry picked from commit 87e9b300045bb708baf1f0216e6261470de3f04f)

commit_message:
Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users

commit_message:
Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

Change-Id: I0fa3934b345d51de85fd9d8a5a211b8e1bc50d86
(cherry picked from commit 87e9b300045bb708baf1f0216e6261470de3f04f)

- gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/87/407587/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial/b911e9f/ : SUCCESS in 34m 24s

- gate-keystone-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/87/407587/1/check/gate-keystone-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial/953e323/ : SUCCESS in 27m 57s
- gate-keystone-dsvm-functional-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/87/407587/1/check/gate-keystone-dsvm-functional-v3-only-ubuntu-xenial-nv/abb9937/ : SUCCESS in 17m 48s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-keystone-uwsgi-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/87/407587/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-keystone-uwsgi-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/ecf7fd1/ : SUCCESS in 1h 12m 51s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/87/407587/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv/653b730/ : SUCCESS in 1h 05m 38s (non-voting)
- keystone-coverage-db-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/87/407587/1/check/keystone-coverage-db-ubuntu-xenial/bddb1b0/ : SUCCESS in 12m 14s'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2016-12-07 03:53:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> Is it valid to have domain_id in roles? And why is it always null?

yes, it became valid when we approved the 'domain specific roles' feature. it is null for the 'global roles' which are the ones we've commonly used"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-04-12 19:40:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > Is it valid to have domain_id in roles? And why is it always
 > null?
 > 
 > yes, it became valid when we approved the 'domain specific roles'
 > feature. it is null for the 'global roles' which are the ones we've
 > commonly used

Yeah - this is accurate, but I'm wondering if it was actually intended. No other token scope actually includes the domain_id from the role reference. This is because we build the role for the token from the id and name of the role reference. The trust token path is the only path that copies whatever the role reference is into the token response. This allows any new role attributes to be present in token responses. This is only apparent for trust scoped tokens. According to the original patch, that's was the only path that was modified to include the domain specific role logic [0].

In hind sight, it might have made sense to just pop the role out of the token if it was a domain specific role instead of leaking the domain_id through, especially since it's impossible for the domain_id to be anything but None in a token response. I'm curious how useful a domain_id: None is in a token response.

Regardless, we can be a little more DRY in the schema definition.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/263064/19"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-04-12 22:01:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-04-16 13:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-04-16 15:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-04-16 17:19:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]

[{'created': '2016-12-06 16:24:01.000000000', 'message': 'Use consistent role schema in token response validation

The tests used a different schema for the roles in the token
response schema for a domain-scoped token vs a project-based
token.

When using the same schema, it turned out some tests have a
domain_id in the roles.

Change-Id: I58d3dc2a3306994890688d5ff40a62cdaedf378e
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 22:01:44.000000000', 'message': "Use consistent role schema in token response validation

The tests used a different schema for the roles in the token
response schema for different token scopes. The role information
shouldn't change depending on the scope, so let's make the test
more DRY by not redefining the role schema in multiple places.

Related-Bug: 1763510
Change-Id: I58d3dc2a3306994890688d5ff40a62cdaedf378e
"}]
commit_message:
Use consistent role schema in token response validation

The tests used a different schema for the roles in the token
response schema for different token scopes. The role information
shouldn't change depending on the scope, so let's make the test
more DRY by not redefining the role schema in multiple places.

Related-Bug: 1763510
Change-Id: I58d3dc2a3306994890688d5ff40a62cdaedf378e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-07 16:22:23.000000000', 'message': "WIP Start from last max row when repeating cleaving

When cleaving is completed but the max row of the retiring db has
changed then cleaving is repeated to avoid losing any rows recently
added to the retiring db.  Previously this meant cleaving every row in
the retiring db again, which is unnecessary and inefficient.  Now only
rows that were added since the last cleaving pass began are cleaved on
a subsequent cleaving pass.

This change requires the cleaving context to be keyed by retiring db
id alone. Previously the db max row id was used in the context key, so
that if the max row changed a new context would automatically be
generated. Now, the max row id is included in the context and the
context is explicitly reset when re-cleaving is required. Note that
the context is still specific to a single replica of the db.

In support of this change, the cleaving context is now encapsulated
cleaving a CleavingContext class. The state being maintained is now
sufficiently rich to warrant a class to ease state manipulation and
testing.  This also separates cleaving context concerns out of the
ContainerBroker, which now simply provides a means to store serialized
cleaving context data.

To complete the separation of concerns, the checks made on cleaving
context prior to changing a broker's db state to SHARDED are moved
from the ContainerBroker to the sharder daemon. This also removes the
need for tedious cleaving context setup in tests to simply get a broker
into sharded state.

Change-Id: Ibe3b1e9d69738a4aad23ade7b28fc534eb5786c9

from the ContainerBroker to the sharder daemon. This also removes the
need for tedious cleaving context setup in tests to simply get a broker
into sharded state.

commit_message:
Start from last max row when repeating cleaving

When cleaving is completed but the max row of the retiring db has
changed then cleaving is repeated to avoid losing any rows recently
added to the retiring db.  Previously this meant cleaving every row in
the retiring db again, which is unnecessary and inefficient.  Now only
rows that were added since the last cleaving pass began are cleaved on
a subsequent cleaving pass.

This change requires the cleaving context to be keyed by retiring db
id alone. Previously the db max row id was used in the context key, so
that if the max row changed a new context would automatically be
generated. Now, the max row id is included in the context and the
context is explicitly reset when re-cleaving is required. Note that
the context is still specific to a single replica of the db.

In support of this change, the cleaving context is now encapsulated in
a CleavingContext class. The state being maintained is now
sufficiently rich to warrant a class to ease state manipulation and
testing.  This also separates cleaving context concerns out of the
ContainerBroker, which now simply provides a means to store serialized
cleaving context data.

To complete the separation of concerns, the checks made on cleaving
context prior to changing a broker's db state to SHARDED are moved
from the ContainerBroker to the sharder daemon. This also removes the
need for tedious cleaving context setup in tests to simply get a broker
into sharded state.

Change-Id: Ibe3b1e9d69738a4aad23ade7b28fc534eb5786c9

commit_message:
Switch heat-engine workers to use os_workers_heat_engine

Previously the default value for the heat-engine workers setting was set
to $::os_service_default. We usually use our specific facts for the
worker settings so this change switches it to use the
$::os_worker_heat_engine fact.

Change-Id: I6a8d745b76afca1b1958816fa10a3f1dd30face6
Related-Bug: #1763671
(cherry picked from commit 8adb596e33de96422ab9858aa5d4984378dce601)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install neutron now directly from pypi
- or use the current branch in CI system using tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to
requirements file.

Change-Id: I416acf75c3db3cdf202a6bc49d96d1abb73b2d6e

Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I15006f3d958c0d376d6832be086f8a5e16cbcf9f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update environment files for Q upgrade and ffwd upgrade

This consolidates the upgrade and ffwd-upgrade related env files,
removing no longer relevant files (like converge vs converge-docker).

In line with recent/ongoing work in tripleoclient [1][2] we now have
cli: overcloud [upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade] [prepare|run|converge]

With this patch we can also change the set/unset of resource 'noop'
and move it from tripleo-common to python-tripleoclient, like I am
pointing at in related client review below. If others agree then I
will do the same with the upgrade-prepare and also the ffwd cli
in [3], i.e. add explicit inclusion of the upgrade-prepare.yaml
and then similarly include the upgrade-converge.yaml for the
upgrade/ffwd-upgrade converge cli.

Related:
  I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2 python-tripleoclient

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/96ffa3a325544206b2fa542bf52bb76531f7d4d6
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558536/5/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557937/4/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_ffwd_upgrade.py@72

Change-Id: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error.
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.
Closes-Bug: #1565928

Change-Id: I31fa34e48f24014885668c249eaf8bb62b70fadc

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Amend lower constraints according to tools/fix-lower-constraints.py and
remove setuptools from requirements.txt to fix requirements job.

Change-Id: I4f336ce65904b5fde9b088a2624fb9196623e295
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 16:32:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E266 too many leading '#' for block comment
- E501 line too long
- H903  Windows style line endings not allowed in code

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I1fd3357479bb2ba3d89de92739ffac99900761b6
(cherry picked from commit 7a714aeb13e99b95a8f495765a1fa57297f92d30)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E266 too many leading '#' for block comment
- E501 line too long
- H903  Windows style line endings not allowed in code

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I1fd3357479bb2ba3d89de92739ffac99900761b6
(cherry picked from commit 7a714aeb13e99b95a8f495765a1fa57297f92d30)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 19:07:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586
(cherry picked from commit 2131880c710d04d1d6030f02f9e257bbfe14d339)
'}]
commit_message:
Add resource-stickiness=INFINITY to VIPs

Right now we do not add any resource stickiness to the VIPs. This has
one consequence when we configure IHA: Namely, when a fenced compute
node comes back (i.e. it recovers), pacemaker is free to move the VIPs
around the controllers (see http://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Clusters_from_Scratch/_prevent_resources_from_moving_after_recovery.html)
to optimize the resource placement. We can observe the VIP moving with
the following message:
Apr 12 06:37:04 [979790] controller-1 pengine: notice: LogAction: * Move ip-10.0.0.110 ( controller-1 -> controller-0 )

This movement of the VIP is highly undesirable because in Instance HA the fence_compute agent needs to talk to keystone via the VIP, and if the VIP is on the move we might get the following errors:
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:23 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[259311] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://10.0.0.110:5000 -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-keystoneclient" ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ Starting new HTTP connection (1): 10.0.0.110 ]
Apr 12 06:37:28 [979787] controller-1 stonith-ng: warning: log_action: fence_compute[261144] stderr: [ keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure: Unable to establish connection to http://10.0.0.110:5000 ]

By setting the resource-stickiness of the VIPs to INFINITY we control how strongly they prefer to stay running where they are.

Change-Id: I6862452d2250ac4c2c3e04840983510a3cd13536
Closes-Bug: #1763586
(cherry picked from commit 2131880c710d04d1d6030f02f9e257bbfe14d339)

commit_message:
Adding missing OVN Metadata service to DVR environments

Current environment files for DVR setups using OVN as a backend are
missing Metadata service. This patch is adding it for both HA and non
HA configurations.

Change-Id: I9bf016e838f193918dc74278b1aaaaa8e7919421
Closes-Bug: 1763044
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix error when creating TimeoutException

We need to have a valid format specifier. Currently this produces:

ValueError: unsupported format character 'w' (0x77) at index 50

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/94/561194/5/check/designate-base/401ff70/testr_results.html.gz

messages:
[{'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-03-29 08:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-29 13:40:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the general best practice is first ot move in-tree, then remove here - and have this one depends-on the in-tree version.'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-04-01 14:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-04-01 14:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> the general best practice is first ot move in-tree, then remove
 > here - and have this one depends-on the in-tree version.

I did do it -- moving the job in-tree and then removing the job outside. But I got comment from Zuul (check the latest one here, its the same - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557630/) saying that it shadows the job in openstack-zuul-jobs. So, I sent another patch removing the job and added dependency on the previous commit.

But then I got another comment from Zuul on openstack-zuul-jobs saying that job is being used in project-config. So, I sent another commit to stop the job being used and made the previous 2 commits depend on this one.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-04-02 12:40:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

follow the dependendencies and steps explained in https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#moving-legacy-jobs-to-projects'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-04-02 13:13:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-04-05 20:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

this should have in the commit message:

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/558211'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-04-06 06:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-04-10 23:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-04-11 03:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Horizon made changes that broke manila-ui. vkmc is working on fixes for for the breakage and they need to progress so taht the dependent change here can pass CI.'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-04-12 19:11:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-04-16 18:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Run ping_test only with old releases

Running ping test depends on Heat and ovb-ha.yaml doesn't have it, go back to
ping test only for old releases.

Change-Id: I1390d74800221ba28dcf966e6c89d99d25b90152

Add zuul-website-media project (1/2)

This git repo can hold large binary blobs (eg videos) that we don't
want to put in the main repo.

subject: Move requirements for the optional drivers (amqp1, kafka)
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 20523, 'name': 'Andy Smith', 'email': 'ansmith@redhat.com', 'username': 'ajssmith'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2017-12-05 14:43:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2017-12-06 14:06:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2017-12-07 15:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-12-07 16:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

It would be better to use setuptools "extras" declarations for this so it is clear which dependency is needed for each driver. See oslo.db's setup.cfg for an example of how that's done.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2017-12-08 16:59:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Doug,

AFAICT moving requirements into setup.cfg will require reintroducing the tox_install.sh script in order to edit out the oslo.messaging contstraint.

My understanding is that infra wants projects to move away from using tox_install.sh.

Is it possible to move reqs to setup.cfg and avoid using tox_install.sh?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:37:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

yes, moving to setup.cfg would result in tox_install.sh.

Monty, do you have a good idea here?'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-04 21:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-05 14:32:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

There's an example of how to do extras with the new test infrastructure in https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/commit/621332cf36d80984d3283b13a6830df6fa16e9f7#diff-380c6a8ebbbce17d55d50ef17d3cf906

It does require duplicating some requirements into test-requirements, but I think it's worth it to avoid forcing people to install requirements they don't need or to install requirements manually."}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-06 14:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-06 14:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-09 15:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-09 17:51:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think we can drop/change the zmq docs, but otherwise this lgtm.

I guess this technically requires a major version bump since it's a semi-breaking change for zmq.  Maybe we want to do the official deprecation before we release this change?"}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-10 22:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-10 22:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-11 17:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

This looks good to me now.  Can we get a release note for the change though?  This seems like something that would be good to communicate to users of the library so they are aware of this new functionality.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-12 19:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-12 20:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-12 20:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-13 14:26:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck the eventlet uncapping and lower constraints patch has merged.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-13 20:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-16 17:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Move requirements for the optional drivers (amqp1, kafka)

Move the requirements for the optional drivers to
test-requirements.txt and setup.cfg.  The default rabbitmq driver's
dependencies should be the only hard requirements for the base
package.

Leaving ZeroMQ deps unchanged for now as it will be removed in Stein

Change-Id: I19dd699ccf87e43202ccefb99258fbaa9ea17b7e

commit_message:
Fix probe test logged exceptions

Fixes exception seen in probe test test_sharded_delete when
_fetch_shard_ranges() from root returned None because root was
deleted.

Fix exception in broker.delete_db when sync_store is None

Change-Id: I361c5cbfb6a98a06cc13e399717ca8f190e92d07

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 02:30:23.000000000', 'message': "add get_sys_meta_header function

As clay said at [1], getting sysmeta header key by using
get_sys_meta_prefix is confusing a little. Because we need to
remember '-' is added at tail of the prefix or not.

This patch add get_sys_meta_header(<server_type>, <name>) and
replace codes to get sysmeta header keys.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/232162/75/swift/common/middleware/symlink.py@135

Change-Id: I056edc68aee8c0db2a2c4a5b9e3d242a895975b3
"}]
commit_message:
add get_sys_meta_header function

As clay said at [1], getting sysmeta header key by using
get_sys_meta_prefix is confusing a little. Because we need to
remember '-' is added at tail of the prefix or not.

This patch add get_sys_meta_header(<server_type>, <name>) and
replace codes to get sysmeta header keys.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/232162/75/swift/common/middleware/symlink.py@135

Change-Id: I056edc68aee8c0db2a2c4a5b9e3d242a895975b3

[{'created': '2018-04-13 18:06:14.000000000', 'message': "Make the broker timeout when sharding configurable

This is a bit of a blunt tool -- might be better to do a temporary boost
when recording progress, based on the amount of time spent *making* that
progress like in manage_shard_ranges -- but I definitely *don't* want to
get through a 4 hour cleave and then *fail to record that*.

Default to 60s, which is more than twice the default timeout, but give
operators the option to set it as they like.

Change-Id: If518d503b0995051f7dafcbb73ac3c9889fe450f
"}]
commit_message:
Make the broker timeout when sharding configurable

This is a bit of a blunt tool -- might be better to do a temporary boost
when recording progress, based on the amount of time spent *making* that
progress like in manage_shard_ranges -- but I definitely *don't* want to
get through a 4 hour cleave and then *fail to record that*.

Default to 60s, which is more than twice the default timeout, but give
operators the option to set it as they like.

Change-Id: If518d503b0995051f7dafcbb73ac3c9889fe450f

Similar to Ic2557ae5ba02924749c4c2b762a7f510483f1046, if
nova gets a network-vif-deleted event, the instance could
be getting deleted and the virt driver detach_interface()
method can raise InstanceNotFound, which would result in
a warning log about something we don't actually need to
care much about. This changes that to a debug level message
for the InstanceNotFound case.

I counted this warning showing up 39 times in a single-node
successful tempest run.

Change-Id: Iacc35d594a9584438d0bcb39b24941e0e7fdecab
Related-Bug: #1741075

nova gets a network-vif-deleted event, the instance could
be getting deleted and the virt driver detach_interface()

a warning log about something we don't actually need to

for the InstanceNotFound case.

I counted this warning showing up 39 times in a single-node
successful tempest run.

Change-Id: Iacc35d594a9584438d0bcb39b24941e0e7fdecab
Related-Bug: #1741075
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log a warning for InstanceNotFound with deleted VIFs

Similar to Ic2557ae5ba02924749c4c2b762a7f510483f1046, if
nova gets a network-vif-deleted event, the instance could
be getting deleted and the virt driver detach_interface()
method can raise InstanceNotFound, which would result in
a warning log about something we don't actually need to
care much about. This changes that to a debug level message
for the InstanceNotFound case.

I counted this warning showing up 39 times in a single-node
successful tempest run.

Change-Id: Iacc35d594a9584438d0bcb39b24941e0e7fdecab
Related-Bug: #1741075

commit_message:
Annotate network parameters for sort_key

Add a 'is_sort_key' keyword for each network's attribute that can
be used as a sort_key. In the future, we will rely on this keyword
to perform validation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/ .

Change-Id: I6104a1b534a7ddc4856bd1a25d77e12b1ed5421f
Related-Bug: #1749820

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints values to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Update msgpack to >=0.5.0 because 0.4.0 is no longer available on PyPI
and we need the lower bound to match the lower constraint.

Change-Id: Ic692cc024bc60b1913fb9eac60be92f7dd353a89
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
