subject: Sync hacking requirement with ironic
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 12:11:11.000000000', 'message': "Sync hacking requirement with ironic

Older hacking appears to break our coinstallability in devstack, as
devstack will install test-requirements.txt, and pbr for some reason
imports modules while installing. Older hacking depends on older flake8
depends on older pep8/pycodestyle, and newer pycodestyle doesn't have a
module named pep8 (which older flake8 uses).

http://logs.openstack.org/62/511162/43/check/ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant/c201a8a/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-04-12_08_39_09_868

Also update the tenacity lower-constraints patch to correspond with the
minimum in requirements.txt, else CI will fail on this.

Change-Id: I395734a8ef52319a1f30c04dd5536673686c2d44
(cherry picked from commit 3ceed50e8039f6d67ece1a61942d662e2239194c)
"}]
commit_message:
Sync hacking requirement with ironic

Older hacking appears to break our coinstallability in devstack, as
devstack will install test-requirements.txt, and pbr for some reason
imports modules while installing. Older hacking depends on older flake8
depends on older pep8/pycodestyle, and newer pycodestyle doesn't have a
module named pep8 (which older flake8 uses).

http://logs.openstack.org/62/511162/43/check/ironic-grenade-dsvm-multinode-multitenant/c201a8a/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-04-12_08_39_09_868

Also update the tenacity lower-constraints patch to correspond with the
minimum in requirements.txt, else CI will fail on this.

Change-Id: I395734a8ef52319a1f30c04dd5536673686c2d44
(cherry picked from commit 3ceed50e8039f6d67ece1a61942d662e2239194c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 18:17:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix fetching own shard range from root during audit

Using the 'includes' param is unreliable when trying to fetch a
specific shard range from the root container because it may match
another overlapping shard range and only the first match will be
returned.  Specifying the shard range name would be specific but is
not currently supported by the container server API, so using marker
and end_marker is a sufficient solution. This has the additional,
unintended, advantage of returning the desired shard range *plus* any
overlapping ranges, which might be useful in the future should the
audit process attempt to correct overlaps.

Change-Id: I4099e53fe5bc91f612ea9905cab724f2298826d5

Change-Id: I4099e53fe5bc91f612ea9905cab724f2298826d5

audit process attempt to correct overlaps.

Change-Id: I4099e53fe5bc91f612ea9905cab724f2298826d5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fetching own shard range from root during audit

Using the 'includes' param is unreliable when trying to fetch a
specific shard range from the root container because it may match
another overlapping shard range and only the first match will be
returned.  Specifying the shard range name would be specific but is
not currently supported by the container server API, so using marker
and end_marker is a sufficient solution. This has the additional,
unintended, advantage of returning the desired shard range *plus* any
overlapping ranges, which might be useful in the future should the
audit process attempt to correct overlaps.

Change-Id: I4099e53fe5bc91f612ea9905cab724f2298826d5

subject: Don't force unicode strings for UUID coercion
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:12:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Given that a valid UUID can't contain unicode data, we shouldn't have changed the return type here.  I think this is correct."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks good.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-16 15:06:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

This feels a bit like we're using a side-effect to detect something we could check for explicitly, but I think the error trapping around it is good so LGTM."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-16 16:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit be2d256d9f09f756647245aa9f302ad30b620ab0'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 21:05:59.000000000', 'message': 'Don't force unicode strings for UUID coercion

Change Ic6b6308fb1960ec40407e6efde30137b64543e72 attempts to
fix difference between Python 2 and Python 3 values by switching
from using str() to formatting into a unicode string (u"%s").

This is equivalent to changing str() to unicode(), but that is
not correct for expected default string types for Python 2.
This requires either using six.text_type(), or just formatting
into a string, without forcing unicode ("%s"), to be correct on
either runtime.

Change-Id: I178f14cdc670d7a696778891e587ef75de208fc2
Closes-bug: #1763179
'}]
commit_message:
Don't force unicode strings for UUID coercion

Change Ic6b6308fb1960ec40407e6efde30137b64543e72 attempts to
fix difference between Python 2 and Python 3 values by switching
from using str() to formatting into a unicode string (u"%s").

This is equivalent to changing str() to unicode(), but that is
not correct for expected default string types for Python 2.
This requires either using six.text_type(), or just formatting
into a string, without forcing unicode ("%s"), to be correct on
either runtime.

Change-Id: I178f14cdc670d7a696778891e587ef75de208fc2
Closes-bug: #1763179

commit_message:
Switch to using run_once instead of matching the first node only

Ansible allows us to run tasks once so we should use that, also
the service add is not something that has to be necessarily be
done on the first node specifically.

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2016-10-27 07:23:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I like this, however I wonder if a better approach is to simply accept a list of class Targets (mutually exclusive of the existing 'topics' list)?

One feature Notifications doesn't currently support is multicast (fanout).  Using a full Target would allow that by setting Target.fanout = True.   In the future we could add support for targetted notifications (by using the Target.server value).

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-27 08:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

I think it is a better approach to encapsulate topic and exchange together in an Target object. also sounds more reasonable. I will change the code.'}, {'account_id': 18414, 'date': '2016-10-27 14:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We add a Targets list here and  mutually exclusive of the existing 'topics' list. That means we need to delete the topics (and topic?) parameter in Notifier API, and then add Target type parameter in Notifier API, I am concerned to break the API, I do not know if it is ok (right) to do that or not? or is there something I thought wrong, please point out for me. :) thanks a lot."}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2016-10-28 07:33:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Shengping - 

You are correct - we can't break backward compatibility with the API.

While I like the idea of using a Target(s) to pass along the exchange name, I'd like to hear the other devs weigh in. 

On further thinking if we do use a target we should not support fanout or named server unless there is a compelling use case.

We'd have to leave in the 'topic' and 'topics' parameters (and honor them) and add a new parameter - say 'targets' - a list of targets."}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2016-10-28 08:20:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Shengping - 

Just to be clear - I'd hold off on changing the patch to use Targets until there is a consensus.

IMHO I like the flexibility of being able to specific multiple exchanges rather than just one, but that would require a larger patch."}, {'account_id': 18414, 'date': '2016-10-31 04:33:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18414, 'date': '2016-10-31 05:20:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-31 06:16:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

commit_message:
Support filter backend based on operation type

This spec proposes to add attribute 'operation'
to RequestSpec when asking scheduler plugins
to perform filtering and weighing.

Partial-Implements: bp support-mark-pool-sold-out
Change-Id: I694ad2f8fab76b39ca1d9f4551102130faf5fc44

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-29 05:38:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913
'}, {'created': '2017-12-03 09:20:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913
'}]
commit_message:
Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: Ia3f3e26410a73d7b44abae637703fda41c4bc09a
Closes-Bug: #1716913

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Id852a3e6c7f9ac39001618384ced8289c2e6866e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: Ie23c9361218a3ecdedd7682fe4dc6236994ac31d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Allow outward_rabbitmq with enable_outward_rabbitmq

outward_rabbitmq is determined  using enable_outward_rabbitmq
property rather than current haproxy_enable_external_vip

commit_message:
Apply cap from upper reqs

Upper reqs limits weren't applied to the tox environment for the kuryr
tempest plugin. This commit sets that on the tox.ini file.

[{'created': '2018-04-16 07:25:51.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966
Change-Id: I8bf80efc04883cd754c19bea0303064080112c6e
(cherry picked from commit f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966
Change-Id: I8bf80efc04883cd754c19bea0303064080112c6e
(cherry picked from commit f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c)

commit_message:
Remove any old client actions that no longer exist

Some clients have removed old deprecated client calls. The mapping.json
still contained references to these causing lots of spurious error
logging.

Change-Id: I64bab08ae4800969dc28d477c1de5bea836af9d1
Closes-Bug: #1744962

subject: Add the docker group to the mistral user
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 02:47:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add the docker group to the mistral user

This allows the workflow driven container prepare to make local docker
calls, which is required for pull/push calls to work when uploading
images to the local registry.

Change-Id: Idcb5a104a3875be0831a134e11ab44bb315b510e
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
'}]
commit_message:
Add the docker group to the mistral user

This allows the workflow driven container prepare to make local docker
calls, which is required for pull/push calls to work when uploading
images to the local registry.

Change-Id: Idcb5a104a3875be0831a134e11ab44bb315b510e
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

[{'created': '2018-01-22 21:53:24.000000000', 'message': 'Allowing Non-IP Traffic in L2 and L3 domains

Non-IP traffic is allowed in L2 and L3 Domains
The default_allow_non_ip setting determines if non-ip traffic is
allowed in Nuage specific L2 and L3 domains.

Change-Id: Ia0a04e3f7893600d5a709b4b8594187e5bc67e9d
'}]
commit_message:
Allowing Non-IP Traffic in L2 and L3 domains

Non-IP traffic is allowed in L2 and L3 Domains
The default_allow_non_ip setting determines if non-ip traffic is
allowed in Nuage specific L2 and L3 domains.

[{'created': '2018-02-28 15:50:40.000000000', 'message': 'Handle a stestr results directory

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

This was Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b but the change
was abandoned, I cannot seem to restore it.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19c
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
'}]
commit_message:
Handle a stestr results directory

Tempest is in the process of switching the tempest run command to use
stestr internally instead of testrepository. This means that results
will be stored in .stestr instead of .testrepository now. This commit
updates the base job tempest run post-processing to check which
directory exists before attempting to copy the results dir.

This was Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19b but the change
was abandoned, I cannot seem to restore it.

Change-Id: Ic1fa3a98b6bcd151c489b078028687892655a19c
(cherry picked from commit d7a53e8cb06da282a8313a59fc0571b30f6e8614)
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

commit_message:
Switch heat-engine workers to use os_workers_heat_engine

Previously the default value for the heat-engine workers setting was set
to $::os_service_default. We usually use our specific facts for the
worker settings so this change switches it to use the
$::os_worker_heat_engine fact.

Change-Id: I6a8d745b76afca1b1958816fa10a3f1dd30face6
Related-Bug: #1763671

commit_message:
Configure control_exchange to match keystone

keystone is using 'keystone' as default control_exchange [1], barbican needs
to match the value so it could consume related events notifications.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/conf/__init__.py#L90

Change-Id: I16c0fb7e79545268b058eb6fd1a006a04e3fb61b

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing
python_runtime to openstack-common, the resource executes once in a

times.

Change-Id: I2e17d655c86fac63e02aaadf5321bc95e2c7aa0b
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 05:44:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove python_runtime references

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing

commit_message:
Remove python_runtime references

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing
python_runtime to openstack-common, the resource executes once in a
given Chef run, instead of attempting to reinstall python multiple
times.

Change-Id: I2e17d655c86fac63e02aaadf5321bc95e2c7aa0b

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I6fd0b50f1d5ff422e87f7cbebc7555738ec68c6b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix create_vnffgd cannot get description from TOSCA file

- Fix create_vnffgd cannot get 'description' and 'name'
from TOSCA yaml file
- Delete redundant 'description' line in vnffgd template
file following the standard in vnffg_usage_guide.rst

Change-Id: I9c384678058c5e27239e9afc8cc2ae1de01ff750
Closes-Bug: #1751433

subject: Remove python_runtime references
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 05:30:19.000000000', 'message': 'Remove python_runtime references

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing
python_runtime to openstack-common, the resource executes once in a
given Chef run, instead of attempting to reinstall python multiple
times.

Change-Id: Ife452a1e21a82c877f4aceb85d768ed2f758e0de
'}]
commit_message:
Remove python_runtime references

In Chef 13+, resource duplication behaves differently. By centralizing
python_runtime to openstack-common, the resource executes once in a
given Chef run, instead of attempting to reinstall python multiple
times.

Change-Id: Ife452a1e21a82c877f4aceb85d768ed2f758e0de

commit_message:
heat-tempest-plugin: add 0001-Add-endpoint_type-config-option.patch

adding https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530460/ as a patch this is
didn't get part of the 0.1.0 release. It's required for running tempest
against a non-public endpoint.

Change-Id: Ia1eaccf10f17788cffdf61c5c4c4b850c1ae561c

[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-14 15:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-03-14 17:25:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Couple of rST nits, but the idea itself seems sound to me'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:37:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Still fine with me'}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-03-16 21:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-03-26 16:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-03-27 14:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Make sense.
Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-04-04 05:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-04-04 10:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Yes please, we need this.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-09 14:40:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)

TBH, I think this is not really necessary and doesn't facilitate the forklift effort that much. It saves some renames that would happen in a new tree, I guess, but not much other than that. The functional change this brings (optionally) is possible today without it.

So I'm like -0.9 on this taking a runway slot from something else I would consider to be more important. But, that rounds up to +0, so if other people think it's worthwhile, then that's fine."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-09 21:15:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

This looks like a great step towards separating placement out of Nova.

That is a step I've wanted to see happen before Cinder looks at using Placement. There may be some requirements there that may force us to not wait, but at least this is some progress towards that end.

To be clear, my issue is not with the stewardship of placement by the nova team, or any concerns that decisions made there will not be to the benefit of other consumers of the placement services. But we increasingly have deployments of Cinder without Nova present, so my concern is that if/when Cinder adds a dependency on placement, we would then require deployers to install at least large parts of nova that they otherwise do not need for their specific scenario."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-11 11:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)

Responses to Dan within.

Main point: cognitive aid.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:18:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I agree with Dan that the *priority* of this effort should be lower than a number of other efforts, and do see the danger in reviewing this particular work taking away from other priority reviews.

That said, I don't see anything wrong with the proposed configuration changes and there are indeed benefits to having a more complete separation of nova and placement.

-jay"}]

commit_message:
Spec for isolating configuration of placement database

This spec provides an optional configuration setting that allows the
placement database to be managed separately from the nova api database.
As described in the spec this will help with extraction of placement and
also provide some options for how people manage data when they want to
migrate.

This spec describes work that is already in progress, linked within.

blueprint optional-placement-database

Change-Id: I7c36e54828da5576cb4093deb49a5fdcd667b4e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 06:42:26.000000000', 'message': "Handle special characters when parsing roles.

In some cases, the generated ansible-inventory
doesn't organize the vars section indenting them,
but includes them into brackets.
The awk statement didn't take this into account and
the '}' character was being included as part of the
role name, ex: 'Controller}'.

(cherry picked from commit 9cb62d90358380409cca673fc9afc68ed1f1e630)

Change-Id: Ida497d60202dff1a73a3cdf88008ccb3c7ba998d
"}]
commit_message:
Handle special characters when parsing roles.

In some cases, the generated ansible-inventory
doesn't organize the vars section indenting them,
but includes them into brackets.
The awk statement didn't take this into account and
the '}' character was being included as part of the
role name, ex: 'Controller}'.

(cherry picked from commit 9cb62d90358380409cca673fc9afc68ed1f1e630)

Change-Id: Ida497d60202dff1a73a3cdf88008ccb3c7ba998d

commit_message:
Pass env-files and roles-data file to update/upgrade prepare cli.

To bypass issue described in RHBZ#1541024 it's needed to pass
 all the environment files, used during initial overcloud deploy,
to the 'overcloud update|upgrade prepare' cli.

Depends-On: I9db2c9256ed20d4d0b74bb467ee6ae0a9633bcc8
Change-Id: I9b488d84fa6e86ed9ce03c7b5fda5d42f713724d
(cherry picked from commit 937274088c25b20ead6ec41d1622888898b67eb4)

commit_message:
Update environment files for Q upgrade and ffwd upgrade

This consolidates the upgrade and ffwd-upgrade related env files,
removing no longer relevant files (like converge vs converge-docker).

In line with recent/ongoing work in tripleoclient [1][2] we now have
cli: overcloud [upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade] [prepare|run|converge]

With this patch we can also change the set/unset of resource 'noop'
and move it from tripleo-common to python-tripleoclient, like I am
pointing at in related client review below. If others agree then I
will do the same with the upgrade-prepare and also the ffwd cli
in [3], i.e. add explicit inclusion of the upgrade-prepare.yaml
and then similarly include the upgrade-converge.yaml for the
upgrade/ffwd-upgrade converge cli.

Related:
  I1288fe68ae8af02a5d77390d237ec467d88e43d2 python-tripleoclient

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/96ffa3a325544206b2fa542bf52bb76531f7d4d6
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558536/5/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557937/4/tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_ffwd_upgrade.py@72

Change-Id: Icfe494e3219d6d6cd3251f75bb4329fc4d793c3c

commit_message:
Run multinode with config-debug.

Appending the environments/config-debug.yaml
env file, allows us having extra log information
at the time of configuring puppet in each
container, setting DockerPuppetDebug and
ConfigDebug.

Change-Id: I5a74cb2bcf933da16474f1f90708f0fbeb21550e

commit_message:
[Scenario] Enable "qos-fip" network extension in tempest config

It is required to run FloatingIP QoS scenario test in test jobs
which uses new zuul v3 syntax (like linuxbridge job for example)

Change-Id: Ibdf99d5abcd3621cb0efe8756253f62e90786ce4

commit_message:
Use EXTRA_TABS/EXTRA_STEPS mechanism to handle manila quotas

The previous manila-ui approach to show shared-file-system default
quotas is too hacky and fragile as the bug reveals.
This commit applies EXTRA_TABS/EXTRA_STEPS plugin interface
introduced to horizon in Rocky to show the manila quota tab
in the default quotas table and quota related forms.

monkey-patching from manila quotas has been dropped.

Note that EXTRA_STEPS feature is being reviewd in horizon
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560679/ so workflow steps related to
manila in the project quota form and the default quota form are not
shown until the corresponding horizon feature is merged.
However, this commit will unblock manila-ui CI so I believe this is
a good compromise.

Note that manila support in the project overview panel is dropped
temporarily as further refactoring in the project overview panel
is being done in horizon side (which will land in Rocky-2).

Closes-Bug: #1759340
Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I22ed7d757c5e5e902f1e85a15c33b34de6c609f1

commit_message:
mnaio service setup skips shade install if using tags instead of skip-tags

This was initially tested with using --skip-tags for the
create_network, create_images or create_flavors so you could
skip the ones you want. A task to install shade however is
skipped if someone uses --tags to specify a single tag. For
both to work, I'm adding an always tag to it.

Change-Id: Ia012a2417c8d6b10698ffe0c0712497eba8f4423
Closes-Bug: 1763080

In networking-ovn we set the binding:host_id of a subport to its

so if that port would be reused on a trunk which is on a different host,
it will not get bound to the Chassis by ovn-controller, thus it won't

commit_message:
Clear binding:host_id when a subport is removed from a trunk

In networking-ovn we set the binding:host_id of a subport to its
parent's. However, when we remove the subport, that info remains there
so if that port would be reused on a trunk which is on a different host,
it will not get bound to the Chassis by ovn-controller, thus it won't
transition to 'up' and never become ACTIVE in Neutron. Tempest test
test_trunk_subport_lifecycle exercises this but the failure doesn't show
up in the gate since both servers are spawned in the same host (we don't
have multinode jobs in the gate).

This patch clears up the host_id when the subport is removed from its
trunk.

Closes-Bug: #1761194
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iea31cb3dd418e086c43a797236c4b71d432422f7

commit_message:
Add ssl-ca configuration option

Allow charm users to provide the SSL Root CA certificate, supporting
the use of an internal Root CA for PKI signing.

This CA certificate will be provided to charms directly consuming
the Vault HTTPS API.

Change-Id: I866e9835c0f47236c160e8ff122eb2cb4fc3f053

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 14:45:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix K8s API access through LBaaS on gates

In the gate K8s API was inaccessible through the LB we create for it.
This means that we could only connect to the API directly through
HOST_IP.

This commit fixes the issue by adding required iptables rule that allows
traffic to the LB and fixes up the member IP added to the LB.

Change-Id: Icd53ec45a479d54015d0506fb5e8bb9896d0a9df
Related-Bug: 555040
(cherry picked from commit 49470991adedbf047567938e5c6c7f2695e62786)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix K8s API access through LBaaS on gates

In the gate K8s API was inaccessible through the LB we create for it.
This means that we could only connect to the API directly through
HOST_IP.

This commit fixes the issue by adding required iptables rule that allows
traffic to the LB and fixes up the member IP added to the LB.

Change-Id: Icd53ec45a479d54015d0506fb5e8bb9896d0a9df
Related-Bug: 555040
(cherry picked from commit 49470991adedbf047567938e5c6c7f2695e62786)

commit_message:
Add tarballed amphora.

This commit modifies the base kuryr-kubernetes/octavia job so it
downloads and uses a tarballed amphora image instead of building it on
the CI for each run.

Change-Id: Ie80e663b906e6f76826319ccccce831aceb9e606

commit_message:
FFU: Use yum shell instead of ansible yum module

Ansible yum module installs all packages available in the repo
 if you use asterix. We instead will use yum -y update name*.

Change-Id: I8e71367ae91faa06313711c6a954c61af705fd8f
Resolves: rhbz#1549845

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: EVPN linuxbridge driver, catch unplug exception

On a VIF unplug, when the bridge was already removed, an
exception was raised.

This change catches this exception to allow processing
to proceed.

Change-Id: I3689af43ecffba2a8c3fd5e5916e127a7142a68c
Closes-Bug: 1764353

"}]
commit_message:
Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130
(cherry picked from commit db081a75c5d2b7a99b4b796f9de7a4aadd7ab522)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I941682ba1eff26bbfcb0c119deb7479c92d35be2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Ensure ansible-pacemaker installation for updates/upgrades.

The ansible-pacemaker module is needed in
the undercloud to run some of the updates/upgrades
tasks. It's generaly installed during 'undercloud
upgrade' step, but as in CI we're using a mixed
version deployment the 'undercloud upgrade' step
is being skipped.

Change-Id: I0c8a36a06bc0f078031fafbafbbdee923a459339
Closes-Bug: #1758880
(cherry picked from commit e2fbfae3edf632f897abb46d4e572a082ba1e76b)

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Octavia]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

(cherry picked from cbb4220411665a3c938f8375e20e4cdd7831d94d)

commit_message:
Undercloud deploy: use docker-uc.yaml

This will make undercloud deploy honor how some services are disabled
in undercloud.yaml, preventing docker.yaml from re-enabling them.

Depends-On: Ifdcb576bc68143aaea8da114b3d18ab7f49ebe62
Change-Id: I1f08d264ad7384f331b30096add2f494d6142a82

commit_message:
Disable services in undercloud.yaml and add docker-uc.yaml

The docker-uc.yaml file is like docker.yaml but intended for
underclouds, meaning it won't reenable non-default undercloud services
by accident.

Change-Id: Ifdcb576bc68143aaea8da114b3d18ab7f49ebe62

commit_message:
Merge undercloud service env files into undercloud env files

Upto now we had to explicitly pass extra environment files to
undercloud deploy command line to enable non-default services. Add the
necessary registry entries to undercloud.yaml and docker-uc.yaml so
that we don't have to do that.

Change-Id: I0cf87affde7333fd5844fb3112d58dda043d6a39

commit_message:
Drop Undercloud* resource registry entries

Change I9be5b68529c2b339ba6ffc259add2b7766f3cc54 unifies the resource
registry entry names for undercloud and overcloud services, so the
Undercloud* names will no longer be needed.

Change-Id: Idb817253f5aed21bee673d6ecf6a05c89ca2693b
Depends-On: I9be5b68529c2b339ba6ffc259add2b7766f3cc54

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 19:23:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
"}, {'created': '2018-04-13 12:58:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9

commit_message:
Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)

commit_message:
Undercloud deploy: use docker-uc.yaml

This will make undercloud deploy honor how some services are disabled
in undercloud.yaml, preventing docker.yaml from re-enabling them.

Change-Id: I9c7b4318da2a31e3639b9cc83cc11f91ed0cd6f3
Depends-On: Ifdcb576bc68143aaea8da114b3d18ab7f49ebe62

commit_message:
Get rid of Undercloud* specific service entries in resource registry

Instead of having separate resource registry entries for services
which should be disabled by default on underclouds, no-op them in
environments/undercloud.yaml. This should make it more DRY and we
don't have to keep adding new container image parameters (after all
they are the same services).

Depends-On: I9c7b4318da2a31e3639b9cc83cc11f91ed0cd6f3
Change-Id: I9be5b68529c2b339ba6ffc259add2b7766f3cc54

commit_message:
Don't pass service env files to undercloud deploy

They have been included by default in the undercloud env files in
change I0cf87affde7333fd5844fb3112d58dda043d6a39.

Also in the spirit of change I24a6021d19ffe74760f9897e9bf3453742939bc9
we now use --output-env-file param for image prepare, for clearer
differentiation between inputs and outputs.

Change-Id: I6d61dee8c19f708bc834a497593122f23ef2baf4
Depends-On: I0cf87affde7333fd5844fb3112d58dda043d6a39

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 19:24:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
"}, {'created': '2018-04-13 12:58:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kernel post-installation script

`/etc/kernel/postinst.d/nova-kernel-permissions.sh` (introduced to fix Bug #1507915) is supposed to make newly installed kernels readable to the nova user, as kernels on an Ubuntu system are otherwise only readable to the root user [0].

This script didn't work for a few reasons:

- It never ran, because scripts in `/etc/kernel/postinst.d` are called by `run-parts`, and run-parts skips any script with a period in the name [1].
- Its shebang was missing its bang
- If installation of the same kernel is installed more than once (e.g. reinstallation), `dpkg-statoverride` (and the whole kernel installation) would exit with error, complaining about an override already existing [2].

Fixed with these changes respectively:
- Renamed script to remove the period
- Fixed typo in shebang
- Added `--force` flag to `dpkg-statoverride`

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/759725
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debianutils/+bug/38022
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1275080

Change-Id: I0e130e3c3ecf2171dbdc0e9a809f8066c30d4bc9
Closes-Bug: 1763479
(cherry picked from commit 7ad805df1fcb18f00d8848acd5a471355c3a1e52)

commit_message:
Create log directories for mysql and redis bundles

This is to make mysql and redis bundles log into conventional
container log directories. The other part of the fix will be to edit
the bundle definitions in puppet-tripleo. Also, the host_prep_tasks
create the readme.txt file with directions, as in other services.

Change-Id: Ic8048b25a33006a3fb5ba9bf8f20afd2de2501ee
Partial-Bug: #1731969

commit_message:
Modify vhost user socket directory's default value in environment file

From ocata, the vhost socket directory requires a different set of
permissions from the default directory (/var/run/openvswitch). Modifying
the directory to a new agreed directory which will be created in puppet.
Closes-Bug: #1687993
Depends-On: I255f98c40869e7508ed01a03a96294284ecdc6a8

Change-Id: I77250ca84c9da2fb5a8381e6f60234f8a05cbf12

commit_message:
Add designate to the services deployed for functional tests

There were some issues with the DNS related cloud functions that went
undiscovered for some time because even though there are tests for it,
those get skipped when designate isn't deployed.

Change-Id: I73f669b999fc65e9950d355ec6dd365c64afdfe4

commit_message:
Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966
Change-Id: I8bf80efc04883cd754c19bea0303064080112c6e

thread starting at

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 15:04:49.000000000', 'message': "doc: Clarify about metadata port owner and port status

In networking-ovn, the metadata port is created under owner network:dhcp
so that it gets auto deleted when the network is removed. Also, this
port will be used to reach the DHCP when there's no gateway setup.
Compared to ML2/OVS, it can confuse operators when they still see a DHCP
port even though the network was created with the --no-dhcp flag. Plus,
as this is a distributed port (OVN localport), it will not get bound to
any chassis and it'll remain DOWN.

This patch is adding this information to the metadata design documentation.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id12b57455ff30eab37a593b85a15313fafd32638
"}, {'created': '2018-04-03 10:31:20.000000000', 'message': "doc: Clarify about metadata port owner and port status

In networking-ovn, the metadata port is created under owner network:dhcp
so that it gets auto deleted when the network is removed. Also, this
port will be used to reach the DHCP when there's no gateway setup.
Compared to ML2/OVS, it can confuse operators when they still see a DHCP
port even though the network was created with the --no-dhcp flag. Plus,
as this is a distributed port (OVN localport), it will not get bound to
any chassis and it'll remain DOWN.

This patch is adding this information to the metadata design documentation.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id12b57455ff30eab37a593b85a15313fafd32638
"}]
commit_message:
doc: Clarify about metadata port owner and port status

In networking-ovn, the metadata port is created under owner network:dhcp
so that it gets auto deleted when the network is removed. Also, this
port will be used to reach the DHCP when there's no gateway setup.
Compared to ML2/OVS, it can confuse operators when they still see a DHCP
port even though the network was created with the --no-dhcp flag. Plus,
as this is a distributed port (OVN localport), it will not get bound to
any chassis and it'll remain DOWN.

This patch is adding this information to the metadata design documentation.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id12b57455ff30eab37a593b85a15313fafd32638

Sorry for my last comment, I copied / pasted from my phone'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-04-13 07:50:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Let me clarify a bit with a shorter example (9 ports where rX can be scheduled in c1, c2 and c3 and Rx only in c1 and c2):

{'c3': [('r1', 3), ('r3', 2), ('r5', 3), ('r7', 3), ('r9', 2)], 'c2': [('r1', 2), ('R2', 2), ('r3', 3), ('R4', 2), ('r5', 2), ('R6', 3), ('r7', 1), ('R8', 2), ('r9', 3)], 'c1': [('r1', 1), ('R2', 3), ('r3', 1), ('R4', 3), ('r5', 1), ('R6', 2), ('r7', 2), ('R8', 3), ('r9', 1)]}
('chassis, ', 'c3', ' prio3 ', 3, ' prio2 ', 2, ' prio1 ', 0)
('chassis, ', 'c2', ' prio3 ', 3, ' prio2 ', 5, ' prio1 ', 1)
('chassis, ', 'c1', ' prio3 ', 3, ' prio2 ', 2, ' prio1 ', 4)

At this point, the load is equally distributed for routers being master, ie. each chassis is hosting 3 master gateways.

c3 goes down:
==========

Now imagine that c3 goes down, which was hosting:
{'c3': [('r1', 3), ('r3', 2), ('r5', 3), ('r7', 3), ('r9', 2)]

c3 was hosting r1, r5 and r7 as master. r1 and r5 are hosted with priority 2 at c2 so they will go to c2. r7 is hosted with priority 2 at c1 so it will go to c1.

As a result, when c3 goes down, its 3 master gateways will be (as equally as possible) distributed to the other two available chassis: ie. 2 will go to c2 and 1 will go to c1. 


c2 goes down:
==========

Let's get back to the initial status and assume that c2 goes down so only c1 and c3 are available:
'c2': [('r1', 2), ('R2', 2), ('r3', 3), ('R4', 2), ('r5', 2), ('R6', 3), ('r7', 1), ('R8', 2), ('r9', 3)]

c2 is hosting r3, R6 and r9 as master so they will fail over to the next prio chassis.
r3 and r9 will go to c3 and R6 will go to c1 (actually R6 can only go to c1 cause c3 was not even a candidate).

Again, the load will be equally distributed as c1 will be hosting 5 mater nodes and c3 4 of them.

Does it make sense now?"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:37:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Again, let me clarify a bit further of something that can happen with this patch.
Imagine that we have this situation:

{'c3': [('r1', 3), ('r2', 1), ('r3', 2), ('r4', 2), ('r5', 3), ('r6', 1)], 'c2': [('r1', 2), ('r2', 2), ('r3', 3), ('r4', 1), ('r5', 2), ('r6', 3)], 'c1': [('r1', 1), ('r2', 3), ('r3', 1), ('r4', 3), ('r5', 1), ('r6', 2)]}

If c3 goes down, r1 and r5 are masters there and will fail over to c2.
This looks unbalanced and it certainly is but the reason why this happens is that at the moment that r5 was scheduled, r6 was not there so c2 was less loaded than c1 (which was hosting 2 prio3 gateways vs 1 prio3 gateway in c2). This made the scheduler to decide that the prio2 host for r5 has to be c5.

The only way to keep the system always balanced would be to reschedule all routers as a new gateway comes in. This is undesirable IMHO as it may involve failovers when rebalancing. This current algorithm ensures that as long as no network nodes go down, the load will be perfectly balanced. In the event that some nodes go down, it won't be super unbalanced (it will be less unbalanced as the number of routers in the system increases) so it's definitely better than it is right now.

Please let me know your thoughts and if you want me to state this somewhere in the code or commit message."}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Also, as the L3 HA mechanism in core OVN is preemptive, if a node which is down comes back up again, the load will be again balanced across the network nodes.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-04-13 11:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

I understand the limitations. But as the patch makes least loaded scheduling better, lets go with it. Thanks a lot Daniel.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-13 15:19:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I'm fine with the behaviour you describe, we could always provide in the future a mechanism to let admins re-balance if necessary (trying to do the minimal changes to re-balance)"}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-13 15:19:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-04-16 09:35:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Let's give it a whril! Thanks Daniel!"}]

'}, {'created': '2018-04-11 15:03:05.000000000', 'message': "L3HA: Take priorities into account in least loaded scheduling

This patch is implementing an algorithm to take the priorities of
the gateway ports into account when choosing a chassis using the
Least Loaded policy (default). Prior to this patch, the same chassis
would always be selected leading to an unbalanced distribution
of the gateway nodes.

Now, when a new gateway is being scheduled, it will take into
account the current priorities and will select the nodes and their
priorities accordingly so that the system remains balance even
in the event that one of the nodes go down.

Also, I'm adding a new functional test which will check that
ports have been scheduled as expected by looking directly into
Southbound database.

Please, note that bug 1762691 could still make routers to not
be in HA mode and we need to address this issue separately.

Closes-Bug: 1762694
Change-Id: I2df35cc31e856b9b574b77dc6b5ab5be262a12b7
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
L3HA: Take priorities into account in least loaded scheduling

This patch is implementing an algorithm to take the priorities of
the gateway ports into account when choosing a chassis using the
Least Loaded policy (default). Prior to this patch, the same chassis
would always be selected leading to an unbalanced distribution
of the gateway nodes.

Now, when a new gateway is being scheduled, it will take into
account the current priorities and will select the nodes and their
priorities accordingly so that the system remains balanced even
in the event that one of the nodes go down.

Also, I'm adding a new functional test which will check that the
ports have been scheduled as expected by looking directly into the
Southbound database.

Please, note that bug 1762691 could still make routers to not
be in HA mode and we need to address this issue separately.

Closes-Bug: 1762694
Change-Id: I2df35cc31e856b9b574b77dc6b5ab5be262a12b7
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If28f2de094d99471a3ab756c947e29ae3d8a28a2
Partial-implements: bp mutable-config
"}, {'created': '2018-03-28 20:45:12.000000000', 'message': "Enable mutable config in Watcher

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
Configuration options are mutable if their oslo.config Opt's
mutable=True is set. This mutable setting is respected when the oslo
method mutate_config_files is called instead of reload_config_files.
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by specifying
the 'restart_method=mutate' parameter, what this patch does.

The default mutable configuration options (set by oslo.config Opts'
mutable=True) are:
- [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version
- [DEFAULT]/debug
- [DEFAULT]/log_config_append

Concrete params, that made mutable in Watcher:

* watcher_decision_engine.action_plan_expiry
* watcher_decision_engine.check_periodic_interval
* watcher_decision_engine.continuous_audit_interval
* gnocchi_client.query_max_retries
* gnocchi_client.query_timeout
* DEFAULT.periodic_interval

Change-Id: If28f2de094d99471a3ab756c947e29ae3d8a28a2
Implements: bp mutable-config
"}]
commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Watcher

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
Configuration options are mutable if their oslo.config Opt's
mutable=True is set. This mutable setting is respected when the oslo
method mutate_config_files is called instead of reload_config_files.
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by specifying
the 'restart_method=mutate' parameter, what this patch does.

The default mutable configuration options (set by oslo.config Opts'
mutable=True) are:
- [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version
- [DEFAULT]/debug
- [DEFAULT]/log_config_append

Concrete params, that made mutable in Watcher:

* watcher_decision_engine.action_plan_expiry
* watcher_decision_engine.check_periodic_interval
* watcher_decision_engine.continuous_audit_interval
* gnocchi_client.query_max_retries
* gnocchi_client.query_timeout
* DEFAULT.periodic_interval

Change-Id: If28f2de094d99471a3ab756c947e29ae3d8a28a2
Implements: bp mutable-config

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I235adfdf373e3693dc5a83a35ae037e157eca6d2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use hiera interpolation for memcached_network

After [1] iptables rules are not set for memcached service
thus services relying on memcached were not functioning well.
With [2] it's requrired to use hiera interpolation for service
configs, this patch fixes it for memcached_network.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551292
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526692

Related-Bug: #1757556
Closes-Bug: #1763009
Change-Id: If9b274192ea4738f455a6106ff1a62eb4e7a5c91

commit_message:
Allow deployer to override vxlan tunnel endpoint IP

This allows the deployer to use standard group_vars and host_vars
to override the value of tunnel_address.

Change-Id: Iff18b547cdf64a537b9432e39b726ca804428f64

commit_message:
Add always tag where it's needed

When running the nova role with the "nova-config" tag the role will
result in failure due to registered variables not being available. This
change simply adds the always tag where it's needed so that the various
tags in the os_nova role can work together or independently.

Change-Id: Id5e8dd2df3c0cbf7cc2e0cf20b5731928dd6a18d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3cb998becd0666d0d449a961aa784fea458486d3)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I27d40ced965e35f5edcb1200faa5d1693cc12544
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix DNS Recordset CRUD

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function
we should lookup the ID to use that in the URL,
as the name in the URL will return a 404.

The `name` parameter for a recordset needs to be the full FQDN
including the zone part. Fix the tests accordingly.

Looking up recordsets via name does not work tests for that behaviour
have been removed.

Also harmonised the naming of vars in the recordset
section to make this clearer.

Also add designate to the services deployed for functional tests

These issues with the DNS related cloud functions went undiscovered
for some time because even though there are tests for it,
those get skipped when designate isn't deployed.

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
Co-Authored-By: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>

commit_message:
Ensure ansible-pacemaker installation for updates/upgrades.

The ansible-pacemaker module is needed in
the undercloud to run some of the updates/upgrades
tasks. It's generaly installed during 'undercloud
upgrade' step, but as in CI we're using a mixed
version deployment the 'undercloud upgrade' step
is being skipped.

Change-Id: I0c8a36a06bc0f078031fafbafbbdee923a459339
Closes-Bug: #1758880

commit_message:
Remove useless module_extra_vars in registry.yml

- remove uesless module_extra_vars, this is a historical issue. In the
  past, we use 'docker exec kolla_toolbox ansible xxx' to run module on
  target node, so complex data have to pass through extra_vars. Now we
  are using kolla_toolbox module, no need to use extra_vars anymore.
- Remove some useless until.

Change-Id: I72ed28001202917f9a82a1c3ea33cd6319911ec8

[{'created': '2018-04-10 13:45:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove shard_cleanups

shard_cleanups was used to delay the deletion of handoff shard dbs
until all cleaving or misplaced object handling had completed for a
given cycle. The one time this was useful was if a destination shard
for misplaced objects overlapped two source shard ranges. Now, a
destination shard handoff db may be created, replicated and deleted
twice, whereas before it was created and deleted once. This
inefficiency is traded off for deleting handoff shard dbs as soon as
they have been replicated in all other cases.

Change-Id: I1e8408451086fe3ba6057ab5779718484a1a2775
'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 13:55:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove shard_cleanups

they have been replicated in all other cases.

Change-Id: I1e8408451086fe3ba6057ab5779718484a1a2775

commit_message:
Remove shard_cleanups

shard_cleanups was used to delay the deletion of handoff shard dbs
until all cleaving or misplaced object handling had completed for a
given cycle. The one time this was useful was if a destination shard
for misplaced objects overlapped two source shard ranges. Now, a
destination shard handoff db may be created, replicated and deleted
twice, whereas before it was created and deleted once. This
inefficiency is traded off for deleting handoff shard dbs as soon as
they have been replicated in all other cases.

Change-Id: I1e8408451086fe3ba6057ab5779718484a1a2775

NGS doesn't use blueprints for feature tracking. Perhaps you could outline your proposal in the RFE, or in a small etherpad linked to the RFE?

I'd still like to know how this relates to the other patch - I don't want to spend time reviewing two implementations of the same feature."}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-14 01:38:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Because I can not see the process about https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550402.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-03-14 09:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Please communicate with Li Xiao. There are differences in the implementations, and we need a single design that works for everyone. One of these patches needs to be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-03-15 21:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

I like this approach, it more generic and let us more flexibility to add Arista support for example.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-16 02:55:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-03-16 05:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-03-16 09:58:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(13 comments)

I've done a first pass through here.

One concern I have is that each of the add_port_group/bond_port calls will create a new SSH connection to the switch, and we've had issues with switches limiting SSH connections both concurrently and within a time window. There are also switches that support transactional configuration changes (Juniper) for which it would be beneficial to make all changes in a single pass. Perhaps other NGS folk can offer thoughts on this."}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-04-09 02:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-09 09:09:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Zachary, we now have another related patch [1] that will conflict with this. I'd like to again request that a spec or design document for this feature be written that captures the various use cases involved, and proposes a solution that works for everyone.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557051"}, {'account_id': 25943, 'date': '2018-04-11 06:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)

@
add spec in ironic-spec? How about adding https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/dynamic-portgroups.html ?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-11 10:09:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I don't think we should modify that existing spec, we can start a new one. There isn't a repo for NGS specs, so my suggestion would be to use ironic-specs. If ironic folks aren't keen on that, perhaps we could create a specs directory in NGS, or create a networking-generic-switch-specs repo."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-04-11 10:11:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Huawei vrpv8 switch support port group

In the Ocata release, Ironic added support for grouping ports
into port groups. The administrator also has the ability to
specify mode and properties of a port group by using appropriate
port group fields. However the administrator is still required to
pre-create a port group on the ToR (Top of Rack) switch manually.

So, we should do something to config switch automatically for port group.

Change-Id: I30d3cddf69f225189864d59b39273923f0468141
Closes-Bug: #1752479

commit_message:
Render crush-initial-weight option if set to 0

Fixes the conditional in the ceph.conf template so it renders the
crush-initial-weight config option if set to 0.

Change-Id: Iaecbdf52bd3731effa3132e61364918407116dbe
Closes-Bug: 1764077

Done"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-03-13 02:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/546357/3/ : FAILURE in 5h 39m 26s'}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-03-13 03:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Two thoughts:
1. Would it not be nice if, there is a flag which is passed along from rebuild_instance to this function which will dictate if, placement logic should be called or not. Checking for is_rebuild in select_destination looks a little out of context to me.
2. If, the current host for any reason fails for image filter say disk space or something, it might be good to try placement logic to find if, we can fit it to another host.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-15 18:20:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Two thoughts:
 > 1. Would it not be nice if, there is a flag which is passed along
 > from rebuild_instance to this function which will dictate if,
 > placement logic should be called or not. Checking for is_rebuild in
 > select_destination looks a little out of context to me.
 > 2. If, the current host for any reason fails for image filter say
 > disk space or something, it might be good to try placement logic to
 > find if, we can fit it to another host.

I don't have good answers for the points you raised. I would leave it to the nova core team to answer."}, {'account_id': 6125, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

zvm:recheck'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-06 12:49:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

> 1. Would it not be nice if, there is a flag which is passed along from rebuild_instance to this function which will dictate if, placement logic should be called or not. Checking for is_rebuild in select_destination looks a little out of context to me.

The is_rebuild flag is used in the same way for the other filters, e.g.:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/f9e13bcfed107c1b91b98c72e72ebbaba7b979ee/nova/scheduler/filters/core_filter.py#L29

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/f9e13bcfed107c1b91b98c72e72ebbaba7b979ee/nova/scheduler/filters/__init__.py#L37

So using the same method in the request is appropriate IMO.

> 2. If, the current host for any reason fails for image filter say disk space or something, it might be good to try placement logic to find if, we can fit it to another host.

rebuild is not meant to move the instance to another host, it's meant to rebuild the instance on the same host with no new resource consumption, and optionally with a new image for the root disk."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-06 12:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-06 12:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I fixed up the nit in the functional test, otherwise this looks good to me. Removing the fix and running the functional test shows the failure.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-06 16:52:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/546357/4/ : SUCCESS in 3h 51m 28s'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-04-12 02:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

is this more of an edge case that the host is at capacity when the rebuild is started? Is this the main thing we are trying to solve?

I am curious what happens in case the host in question is fenced for whatever reason etc.

I assume placement api makes all the check to make sure the host is available and not fenced etc. 

so we will lose those checks, correct? is that acceptable?

I am just getting familiar with this workflow, so apologies if its a dumb question :)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-12 17:33:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> is this more of an edge case that the host is at capacity when the rebuild is started?

Maybe, but does it matter? Before I11746d1ea996a0f18b7c54b4c9c21df58cc4714b we used to never call the scheduler during a rebuild, but there was a CVE for that in case the new image doesn't fit the current instance.host. Then by a series of side effects of that, we realized that we need to call the scheduler but not all of the filters, because they could kick the host out even though we aren't making new requests for resources, see: I1a46ef1503be2febcd20f4594f44344d05525446. Since placement currently really only deals with quantitative resource requests (vcpu, ram, disk), it's not appropriate to exclude the current host during a rebuild because placement says it's at capacity, since we're not going to claim new resources.

> Is this the main thing we are trying to solve?

Yes, for this specific bug.

> I am curious what happens in case the host in question is fenced for whatever reason etc.

That's never stopped us from doing a rebuild on it. If the host is literally fenced so that the controller can't RPC cast to it, then everything is going to fail for that instance.

> I assume placement api makes all the check to make sure the host is available and not fenced etc. so we will lose those checks, correct? is that acceptable?

Placement doesn't have any idea about whether or not the compute host is fenced. Placement doesn't even have a concept of a compute host for that matter, only resource providers.

> I am just getting familiar with this workflow, so apologies if its a dumb question :)

Asking questions is totally fine, there is a long and confusing history here per those changes above. I don't, however, think it's appropriate to -1 a patch because of questions for background and understanding on the issue."}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-04-12 17:46:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

> > is this more of an edge case that the host is at capacity when
 > the rebuild is started?
 > 
 > Maybe, but does it matter? Before I11746d1ea996a0f18b7c54b4c9c21df58cc4714b
 > we used to never call the scheduler during a rebuild, but there was
 > a CVE for that in case the new image doesn't fit the current
 > instance.host. Then by a series of side effects of that, we
 > realized that we need to call the scheduler but not all of the
 > filters, because they could kick the host out even though we aren't
 > making new requests for resources, see: I1a46ef1503be2febcd20f4594f44344d05525446.
 > Since placement currently really only deals with quantitative
 > resource requests (vcpu, ram, disk), it's not appropriate to
 > exclude the current host during a rebuild because placement says
 > it's at capacity, since we're not going to claim new resources.
 > 
 > > Is this the main thing we are trying to solve?
 > 
 > Yes, for this specific bug.
 > 
 > > I am curious what happens in case the host in question is fenced
 > for whatever reason etc.
 > 
 > That's never stopped us from doing a rebuild on it. If the host is
 > literally fenced so that the controller can't RPC cast to it, then
 > everything is going to fail for that instance.
 > 
 > > I assume placement api makes all the check to make sure the host
 > is available and not fenced etc. so we will lose those checks,
 > correct? is that acceptable?
 > 
 > Placement doesn't have any idea about whether or not the compute
 > host is fenced. Placement doesn't even have a concept of a compute
 > host for that matter, only resource providers.
 > 
 > > I am just getting familiar with this workflow, so apologies if
 > its a dumb question :)
 > 
 > Asking questions is totally fine, there is a long and confusing
 > history here per those changes above. I don't, however, think it's
 > appropriate to -1 a patch because of questions for background and
 > understanding on the issue.

I wanted to more discussions going before merging hence the -1. 
Thanks for clarifying that placement does not have any checks for the resource providers, i was trying to see if we are losing anything else by not going through placement."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-12 19:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-12 19:09:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-12 21:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-13 01:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

commit_message:
Skip placement on rebuild in same host

If the instance is rebuilt with a different image in the same
host, we don't need to call placement because there is no change
in resource consumption.

Change-Id: Ie252271ecfd38a0a1c61c26e323cc03869889f0a
Closes-Bug: #1750623

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Iaeed4026962e635f68013ff8d175f0e20bffe415
Closes-Bug: #1763300
(cherry picked from commit 342f723006d3c4bf0c97a4ccc39639c89102b36f)

be updated

commit_message:
Do not use pip 10 or higher

It looks pip 10 failed the uninstallation of distutils installed
packages. This patch temporarily cap the version of pip to work-around. 

Closes-Bug: #1763966
Change-Id: I8bf80efc04883cd754c19bea0303064080112c6e
(cherry picked from commit f99d1771ba1882dfbb69186212a197edae3ef02c)

subject: Fix locales on Ubuntu
messages: [{'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-04-14 22:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-15 16:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-16 08:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-14 22:49:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix locales on Ubuntu

The new Ubuntu base image we use does not ship with any locales
or locale configuration. A fix[1] attempted to remedy this by
copying the default locale configuration from the host, but it
is not a valid fix since the locale from the host is not present
or generated in the container cache. This causes things to break
on the system when valid locales are used, such as database
systems[2].

Instead, to prepare locales in Ubuntu[3], we should install the
locales package and provide a list of valid locales to prep
the base image. It is not necessary to copy /etc/default/locale
from the system. The first locale provided will be used as
the system's base locale by running 'update-locale' which
builds /etc/default/locale.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/e62de979cbabd2f2c42c5ce5a615c7fa84cd3cfd
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/719241/
[3] https://www.thomas-krenn.com/en/wiki/Configure_Locales_in_Ubuntu#No_locale_set

Change-Id: Iaa5351777d7db464e8a897fdf33c0f440bfa601b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix locales on Ubuntu

The new Ubuntu base image we use does not ship with any locales
or locale configuration. A fix[1] attempted to remedy this by
copying the default locale configuration from the host, but it
is not a valid fix since the locale from the host is not present
or generated in the container cache. This causes things to break
on the system when valid locales are used, such as database
systems[2].

Instead, to prepare locales in Ubuntu[3], we should install the
locales package and provide a list of valid locales to prep
the base image. It is not necessary to copy /etc/default/locale
from the system. The first locale provided will be used as
the system's base locale by running 'update-locale' which
builds /etc/default/locale.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/e62de979cbabd2f2c42c5ce5a615c7fa84cd3cfd
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/719241/
[3] https://www.thomas-krenn.com/en/wiki/Configure_Locales_in_Ubuntu#No_locale_set

Change-Id: Iaa5351777d7db464e8a897fdf33c0f440bfa601b

Gordon,

Just saw your comments for patchset 4 after uploaded patchset  5. Can you check my answer for 4?
Thanks,'}, {'account_id': 11235, 'date': '2015-11-19 12:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Gordon,
Paste my comments here:

>this is really interesting way to broadcast alarm, how does it work with
>multiple workers?

We have no clear design for partition now. But I believe it can just follow our partition policy in future: send this 'alarm.timeout.start' event to the worker who owns the event_type if partition with event, or send it to the alarm(related notification bus) if partition with alarm.
'*.start‘ is related to one alarm with some specific event, we should have a way to fit it in the future partition infrastructure.


>why do we need this end event? can't we just update alarm and stop tracking
>it once either event arrives or timeout is hit?

This is discussed in the "Alternatives" section. It requires locks for both evaluator and timeout process to update the alarm data structure and DB. It need add locks to current code with check if timeout thread exist, which is not clean. But it does save one event broadcast, I'll try this in my implementation and pick up one.


>how does repeat-actions work with a timeout? does it restart?

repeat-actions doesn't restart timeout. In fact, repeat-actions should only re-trigger the action in transition to same state. Different repeat-actions setting should not lead different final state for same event sequence. In following repeat-actions=True chart, 'OK' should go 'OK' upon 'EVENT'. Will modify it.'}, {'account_id': 11235, 'date': '2015-11-20 04:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11235, 'date': '2015-11-20 04:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Fix the repeat-actions setting for alarm start transition.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-20 04:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1
