- gate-ceilometer-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/12/239312/7/check/gate-ceilometer-specs-python27/f12cb33/ : SUCCESS in 1m 50s'}, {'account_id': 1894, 'date': '2015-11-24 13:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi, sorry for being late to join this review.

I have the following concerns for having master data (even context) in evaluator process:

(1) evaluator can be down or rebooted, how we can recover the data in dead evaluator?

(2) each event has to be passed to relevant evaluator that makes difficult to implement multi worker...

(3) evaluator may have the large number of threads (up to the number of assigned alarms), can we limit?


But, if this bp is the one we can realize timeout solution, I won't object it.

(alt-1) building timeout mechanism in each OpenStack component as their responsibility to capture resource state, good example is "instance_build_timeout" in nova. how about changing nova to accept instance_build_timeout for each VM/server? I know this may take more time to land, but this maybe good for clients to see consistent state view with nova and event via ceilometer.

(alt-2) store events in the deployment and ask user to set alarms against event database. I guess this won't fill your requirement, since this may take log time to eval and fire
alarm notification, but it may scale.


I also want to discuss other potential to implement this feature. This adds new type of alarm which request evaluator   to support further evaluation after the first evaluation. This is the same requirement if we thinking of supporting prompt comb alarm evaluation with event alarms, so we can have common mechanism to achieve them (like some extensible pipeline mechanism for alarm evaluation).'}, {'account_id': 11235, 'date': '2015-11-24 19:27:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Patch Set 7:
I have the following concerns for having master data (even context) in evaluator process:
(1) evaluator can be down or rebooted, how we can recover the data in dead evaluator?

edwin> Can we put some data in DB, and ask evaluator restart timeout thread according to when recovering?


(2) each event has to be passed to relevant evaluator that makes difficult to implement multi worker...

edwin> Each generated timeout event holds enough information: for which alarm listening which event. They are just like normal event, so can utilize future partition infrastructure. BTW, any design at this point for work partition?


(3) evaluator may have the large number of threads (up to the number of assigned alarms), can we limit?

edwin> Good question. we can have one timeout thread per evaluator, and push new timeout request to it. Timeout thread pickup next timeout request in the queue, and sleep for specific time. When wake up, send timeout notification then pick up next request again.


(alt-1) building timeout mechanism in each OpenStack component as their responsibility to capture resource state,

edwin> For alt-1, as you said, it's hard to push. And it is lack of flexibility for user to define his own event.


(alt-2) store events in the deployment and ask user to set alarms against event database. 

edwin> For alt-2, it works but not real-time. We use event-alarm as it can notify us immediately. 


I also want to discuss other potential to implement this feature. This adds new type of alarm which request evaluator to support further evaluation after the first evaluation. This is the same requirement if we thinking of supporting prompt comb alarm evaluation with event alarms, so we can have common mechanism to achieve them (like some extensible pipeline mechanism for alarm evaluation).

edwin> For new type of alarm infrastructure, are you saying that make notification listener hooks a series of evaluators including current event-alarm, comb event-alarm, and even event-timeout-alarm (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199005/)? So each set of events need go through each evaluator. If so, I can make a BP for it.

edwin> BTW, I think timeout in my BP is not a new type alarm(like above event-timeout-alarm), but just new parameter for current event-alarm. One is event-alarm-timeout, another is event-timeout-alarm."}, {'account_id': 11235, 'date': '2015-11-25 17:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11235, 'date': '2015-11-25 17:43:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Address mibu's comments:
1. only one timeout thread per evaluator
2. mentioned disaster-recovery for timeout thread when evaluator crash
3. mentioned enough info carried by 'alarm.timeout.*' event, which can be used for future partitioning infrastructure."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-25 17:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

I think this is good to start development. Apologies for delay in response.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2016-01-25 20:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

this is fine. i will follow up with a cleanup'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-01-25 20:45:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Verified

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-01-25 20:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+2

Build succeeded (gate pipeline).

commit_message:
Add spec for event-alarm timeout

This BP adds timeout mechanism for event-alarm. End user can specify a
timeout, 0 (no timeout) by default for each event-alarm, and alarm
status becomes 'OK' after timeout without receiving desired event.

blueprint event-alarm-timeout

Change-Id: Icff04a0cbfd1322ce8573650c56d180768786389

commit_message:
set default python to python3

Set the default python to python3 except for the py27 environment. We
have to set that explicitly to override the new default.

Change-Id: Ib90566414f0967b2c7c7633950e3dc2fa8634982
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-13 09:32:19.000000000', 'message': "Adapt the list of ceph packages for SUSE

SUSE needs more than one distro package for rados support. If
they aren't installed, issues like this [1] appear.

Sadly, the current variable expects only one package name,
and not a list of packages.

This change does the minimum job to make it work, simply
renaming the internal variable (renaming package with
packageS) for readability purposes, and using this new
variable as a list in the provided ``vars/main.yml``.

commit_message:
Adapt the list of ceph packages for SUSE

SUSE needs more than one distro package for rados support. If
they aren't installed, issues like this [1] appear.

Sadly, the current variable expects only one package name,
and not a list of packages.

This change does the minimum job to make it work, simply
renaming the internal variable (renaming package with
packageS) for readability purposes, and using this new
variable as a list in the provided ``vars/main.yml``.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/master/openstack-ansible-deploy-ceph-opensuse-423/266bcd0/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-08_07_27_36_061674

Change-Id: I4bb8bb3bc5840fa1d5159ceb91acea83bd5efce4
(cherry picked from commit cf55b9b06638a536fdf87c24b39ab9065a0d1b46
 and I746b27182075b6d55fe2161043768c6692828d64)

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove .egg-info files for pip10

pip10 started refusing to remove distutils installed packages.  While
the removal isn't generically safe, this works well enough for us.

commit_message:
Fix requirements

1. remove unused requirement: mock-requests. This is due to the fact
   that is is unused.
2. Update sphinx
3. Uncap evenlet: uncap eventlet. We will manage the eventlet
   version using constraints now. See the thread starting at
   http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
   for more details.
4. Update RYU to be 4.24 to sort out issues with pip 10

Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Change-Id: I855f88ca09a735054c3582f16d8eff977dc53ce1

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints job

* bump lower-constraint for cassandra-driver version to 3.3.0
* add cassandra-driver and influxdb to extras
* execute lower-constraints job with python 2.7
* move common commands to [testenv]
* fix lower-constraint for sphinx
* add funcsigs to lower-constraints.txt

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555402
Change-Id: Idc2351e597ce933fa5c83a6c872ae241ce4b0220

Fix DB connection url in config guide

Change MySQL DB default driver to PyMySQL in
config guide to align with Dockerfile.

And some grammar fixes.

Closes-Bug: 1762720

Change-Id: Ia2d0a49567f51b8e6ecdf1967c515ef0dfe81567

commit_message:
Allow vhost socket directory user/group as configurable from template

For ovs2.8 version, it is required to modify the vhost socket directory
permissions as openvswitch:hugetlbfs instead of the earlier hardcoded
values qemu:qemu. Making these values as input which could be configured
from templates.

Change-Id: Ia2d0a49567f51b8e6ecdf1967c515ef0dfe81567
(cherry picked from commit 361785f14d9965b0f81706dfbe3a01550a110b1a)

metrics in Alarm Details section of Alarm History view. Without this
list the output is incomplete and confusing.

Task: 12529

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ia2e678723fd7769d037df336b992bdcc67be4948
(cherry picked from commit e94947aea41422255d4520f30c3a042bca85cbbf)

TODO: unit test for is_deleted in various states.

Previously is_deleted() failed to consider retiring db objects while
SHARDING nor shard range contents when the container was SHARDED.

Now, the object_count considered in is_deleted() is the same as

Change-Id: I62614ea2087d1c6444260823710ea26691b3e894
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 12:33:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ContainerBroker.is_deleted() method

Previously is_deleted() failed to consider retiring db objects while
SHARDING nor shard range contents when the container was SHARDED.

Now, the object_count considered in is_deleted() is the same as
that returned in the result of broker.get_info().

In SHARDING or SHARDED states any misplaced objects are *not*
considered in is_deleted.

Change-Id: I62614ea2087d1c6444260823710ea26691b3e894
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ContainerBroker.is_deleted() method

Previously is_deleted() failed to consider retiring db objects while
SHARDING nor shard range contents when the container was SHARDED.

Now, the object_count considered in is_deleted() is the same as
that returned in the result of broker.get_info().

In SHARDING or SHARDED states any misplaced objects are *not*
considered in is_deleted.

Change-Id: I62614ea2087d1c6444260823710ea26691b3e894

subject: Add group configuration to qemu.conf file
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 07:34:48.000000000', 'message': "Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

Change-Id: I0fa3934b345d51de85fd9d8a5a211b8e1bc50d86
(cherry picked from commit 87e9b300045bb708baf1f0216e6261470de3f04f)
"}]
commit_message:
Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

Change-Id: I0fa3934b345d51de85fd9d8a5a211b8e1bc50d86
(cherry picked from commit 87e9b300045bb708baf1f0216e6261470de3f04f)

commit_message:
use minimal to verify ping/tempest

The minimal config is only used outside of the upstream CI
system.  We cover both ping and tempest upstream but not
across all the releases.  Let's use minimal.yml as the
config that should work across rleases to verify that
both ping and tempest are working correctly from a
CI standpoint.

Change-Id: I23cb01a5f753214897a0e59b4adc45e910fb3cf3

commit_message:
Enable pep8 on the integration directory

Currently trove/integration is disabled for pep8. This patch set
enables pep8 scanning in that directory by removing it from the
exclusion list.  Also, address any issues discovered by enabling
pep8.

Change-Id: I292b6760e96e71abd7019881b95926cba7ce09fe
Closes-Bug: #1642554

commit_message:
[WIP] Implements a keystone auth webhook

This patch set adds a chart for a webhook process to enable
keystone-based authN/authZ for kubernetes APIs.

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: Ib357336eb165cf642f6793ff6cdde7d53075b158
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: Ib357336eb165cf642f6793ff6cdde7d53075b158

commit_message:
Re-use undercloud upgrades tasks.

Both upgrades and updates rely on a previous
undercloud upgrade step to run. Currently,
both were implementing its own tasks for upgrading
the undercloud. So, this patch brings them both
together into a single template.

Change-Id: Icb66a4a69bf04c30155999d374b413204df7fc82
(cherry picked from commit f5929d55f86d9c12cc4c01b06a1dec293e5388e2)

Change-Id: Ida497d60202dff1a73a3cdf88008ccb3c7ba998d
"}, {'created': '2018-04-10 13:30:58.000000000', 'message': "Handle special characters when parsing roles.

In some cases, the generated ansible-inventory
doesn't organize the vars section indenting them,

The awk statement didn't take this into account and

commit_message:
Handle special characters when parsing roles.

In some cases, the generated ansible-inventory
doesn't organize the vars section indenting them,
but includes them into brackets.
The awk statement didn't take this into account and
the '}' character was being included as part of the
role name, ex: 'Controller}'.

Change-Id: Ida497d60202dff1a73a3cdf88008ccb3c7ba998d

ready to merge if OK.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-04-13 06:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

@Eric, why is it only added to api-base , not the replicated ones or py35?'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-04-13 17:55:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Thanks Anusha!

Not in py35 because monasca support is not fully there.

Not in replicated because setting up monasca is quite heavy and time-consuming and I didn't want to lengthen the already long replicated job, considering that the benefit of including monasca there seems small: if replicated breaks monasca polling for some reason (I can't think of any), it's almost certainly the case that some other polling would also fail.

Notice how the base test is usually a few minutes faster than the replicated test. With the monasca setup added to the base test, it's not 5-10 minutes slower than the replicated test. monasca setup seems to adds 10-15 minutes.

Just my thoughts anyway."}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-04-16 05:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

@Eric, ok, got it'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-04-16 05:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 03:54:37.000000000', 'message': "Add a note about configuration of ws url

The common problems that users ran into is that they are not
able to access the container's console in browser (via Horizon).
The reason is that the ws_proxy's URL is not accessible from
the browser. Either the configured IP address is not accessible
from outside or the port was blocked. This patch adds a note to
explain how to configure the websocket proxy's URL propertly.

Change-Id: Ifac45550f22409c2348e1b14ff46606a7bf09a89
(cherry picked from commit e5a9190e1c669e035bb350fb1cb1bf474c668cb4)
"}]
commit_message:
Add a note about configuration of ws url

The common problems that users ran into is that they are not
able to access the container's console in browser (via Horizon).
The reason is that the ws_proxy's URL is not accessible from
the browser. Either the configured IP address is not accessible
from outside or the port was blocked. This patch adds a note to
explain how to configure the websocket proxy's URL propertly.

Change-Id: Ifac45550f22409c2348e1b14ff46606a7bf09a89
(cherry picked from commit e5a9190e1c669e035bb350fb1cb1bf474c668cb4)

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated term, Usage: Action

Replace the deprecated term, Usage: Action, with the new
term, Scope: Public, in the file, Environment.yaml.

This will remove the deprecated warning messages in the
murano-engine log file.

Change-Id: I2f798bac1b2fd60ead1a2396ad1d24def300a33d
Closes-Bug: 1763836

subject: Add openvswitch/hugetlbfs user and group on update
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-14 07:33:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add openvswitch/hugetlbfs user and group on update

When we bring ovs 2.9 we will need to have openvswitch user
and hugetlbfs group, in order for ovs to work properly. As the
package is not taking care of it, create it on the update tasks.

Co-Authored-By: Zenghui Shi <zshi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I792dd0e1cac1782499413f01b5d40d3b338fd5b1
'}]
commit_message:
Add openvswitch/hugetlbfs user and group on update

When we bring ovs 2.9 we will need to have openvswitch user
and hugetlbfs group, in order for ovs to work properly. As the
package is not taking care of it, create it on the update tasks.

Co-Authored-By: Zenghui Shi <zshi@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I792dd0e1cac1782499413f01b5d40d3b338fd5b1

'}]
commit_message:
Make use of mock instead of mox

We needed to create the own instance of ContainsKeyValue
as this causes the lower constraints tests to fail.

Change-Id: I908ca624b1ce43d1d5fb0c66f0fdd436efa4e317

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

To pass the gate, this patch also fixes the incompatible lower constraints
that don't match the lower bounds in the requirements files.

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iff15cb1fad5d223d5874117d020a6ee909022102
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Temporarly mark 3node job as non-voting

There's a bug in TestNetworkBasicOps tempest job that prevent patches to
land, and it's impacting 3node job, and the fix for this is creating a
circular dependence.

Change-Id: I339a0fef6b73ba2404d8797b8767fca9cf919664
Related-Bug: 1757556

commit_message:
decouple neutron db models and ovo for neutron-lib

This spec provides details on how we can break consumer dependencies
on neutron's database model as well as object imports by
exposing neutron objects as entry points that are discoverable and
loadable from neutron-lib. This spec is part of a set of specs related
to decoupling the db for neutron-lib (see patch topic).

Change-Id: I079d06502e6e7b1e20aea882979b0ecd9106eaeb

[{'created': '2017-06-12 16:57:59.000000000', 'message': "decouple db related access for neutron-lib

As part of the neutron-lib effort, we need a way to decouple
sub-projects who import/use neutron database related modules
(neutron.db, neutron.objects, etc.). This spec proposes a means to do
so allowing us to rehome the portions of neutron's database related
modules into neutron-lib as we see fit.

commit_message:
rehome db api and utils into neutron-lib

This spec provides details on how we can break consumer dependencies
on neutron's db API and utilities by rehoming respective generic
functionality into neutron-lib. It's 1 spec in a set related to
decoupling sub-projects from neutron's db logic/layer.

Change-Id: I7b04e202321e1422e53c59c2bab0c85946fcb704

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints values to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I113e66639c61d0a870037c252415a07879e24872
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints settings to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I9b2cdb68fd87e07d9ae0226bc2c1d77d6981ef52
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove [build_sphinx] section as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

This patch also changes minor things in doc.

Change-Id: Ib1c525d6a2f7e5477539155bfc3050b1905aad3e

(3 comments)

I feel strange to mapping all the API response to the rule 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:index'.

And we didn't doc that the rule 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:index' is useful for those API responses.

I'm thinking of adding a new rule, like this 'os_compute_api:flavors:[show|detail]:extra-specs', and its default rule is 'rule:os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:show'. Then we link this two rule together.

And sounds like we need to do add rule 'os_compute_api:flavors:[show|detail]' first. This is part of spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547850/."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-04-13 09:50:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I think you should define a separate policy rule (from the existing one you're currently using) that would define the policy for all os-flavors REST actions."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-13 14:27:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> I feel strange to mapping all the API response to the rule 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:index'.

This is following the pattern already introduced with microversion 2.47 to show embedded flavors, with their extra specs, in GET /servers/{server_id} and GET /servers/detail.

> And we didn't doc that the rule 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:index' is useful for those API responses.

Sure we could update the docs for the policy to indicate it's used by other APIs.

> I'm thinking of adding a new rule, like this 'os_compute_api:flavors:[show|detail]:extra-specs', and its default rule is 'rule:os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:show'. Then we link this two rule together.

Can we not hold this up on deciding what to do about granular policy rules? That spec isn't even merged yet."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-04-13 14:30:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

> Sure we could update the docs for the policy to indicate it's used by other APIs.

Yes, please. I don't want to hold that specific change just for a docfix, but please provide a follow-up for that."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-13 14:32:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(4 comments)

I agree with updating the docs for the policy rule that's being re-used here, but that's a bug fix IMO since it's already a problem for 2.47. I'm not in favor of holding this up for figuring out granular policy, we can cross that bridge once we have agreed that it's a bridge which needs to be crossed."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-13 14:44:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Let's make the policy doc changes under bug 1763741."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-04-13 15:28:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-13 16:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Add microversion to support extra_specs in flavor API.

Exposes flavor extra_specs in the flavor representation since
microversion 2.61. Now users can see the flavor extra-specs
in flavor APIs response only and do not need to call
``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}/extra_specs`` API.

Flavor extra_specs will be included in Response body of the
following APIs:

* ``GET /flavors/detail``
* ``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}``
* ``POST /flavors``
* ``PUT /flavors/{flavor_id}``

Part of blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I048747633babf690a63c6de9773bff5547872053

commit_message:
Add ceph integrated repo testing

Ceph client should exercise the integrated ceph job on demand.
This allows to see if a ceph client change breaks the ceph
jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559781/
Change-Id: I91a23b9b79c497d48cbe6837dd8c9eaaa65e23bf
(cherry picked from commit 93ad121198a17d1e2e24ae446515f4b90fa2dc7f)

(4 comments)

I didn't look at all the change, but before I looking further into the implementation, could you guys please consider my following concerns:

- For image type functions, we could easily config the resource limit in pod definition, that's the limitation for the whole pod, not the function inside the pod. But i didn't test to invoke the image type function in parallel, i feel there may be some bugs.
- For package/swift type functions, the resource limitation should happen in the individual process who is responsible for executing the function, so we need to pass the limitation config to the worker pod in the k8s deployment

Also, the doc and release note should be added together with the patch.

Anyway, @Jiangyuan, thanks a lot for picking up this, you can  find me on IRC during 9:00AM to 12:00AM in your time zone, feel free to have a chat."}, {'account_id': 27695, 'date': '2018-03-21 02:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
add customized mem/cpu for image type function

When creating image type function, allow users to specify cpu
and memory_size resources for the function.

But cpu and memory_size should be integers and within the range
specified in config.py.

Story: 2001586
Task:  6535
Change-Id: I7a5e631701fd652b5f6891bd1444d0135e1463b2

commit_message:
Remove apply of iptables rules for gentoo

This is applying the iptables rules during the build on the builder.
This will need to be converted into a script to run on boot or
similar.

Change-Id: Icc753013f218c3e4f04031c2fdbc7b32a534d887

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 16:31:03.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687
"}, {'created': '2018-04-10 16:43:10.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Also, since we're racing to update the volume status to 'reserved',
this adds 'reserved' in the list of expected statuses for a
multiattach=True volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687
"}, {'created': '2018-04-10 17:59:30.000000000', 'message': "Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the

we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,

to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687
"}]
commit_message:
Refresh volume when checking for conflicting attachments

We should only be able to create more than one attachment to the
same volume if it's (1) multiattach=True or (2) it's multiattach=False
AND the attachments are to the same instance. It is not valid to
attach more than one instance to the same multiattach=False volume.

The _attachment_reserve method is checking for this if the
conditional update to the volume status fails, but it does
not refresh the volume before checking the attachments. Since
we could be racing to create attachments concurrently, when
the request that failed the conditional update actually pulled
the volume out of the DB, it might not have had any attachments,
so we need to refresh it before checking the list of attachments
to see if the instance we're trying to attach (reserve the volume)
is the same as what's already attached to the volume.

Change-Id: Iee78555163bbcbb5ff3e0ba008d7c87a3aedfb0f
Closes-Bug: #1762687

commit_message:
Add df_skydive_service to dragonflow

To enable skydive, one should now enable the service in the local.conf
file using the following line:
enable_service df_skydive

If you would like to install the SkyDive analyzer on the same node, the
SkyDive install lines MUST be before the DragonFlow ones!
Please see doc/source/single-node-conf/etcd_skydive_local_controller.conf
file for usage example

Change-Id: I66c3eaf18904ae1c109d0ca8007269c41261d791
Depends-On: c5921051d7bc05d2c29494be842329e2ffcc008a
Related-Bug: #1749429

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints values to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2974d8d119664e6d21decc6f4fc5b16fdb5724a0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Gate: update paths for pip 10 installation

Pip>=10 moves the entrypoint to /usr/local/bin from /usr/bin, this
ps forces the shell to forget all locations following upgrade
to allow it to adapt to the new location.

Change-Id: I1ed92b75f689e982397cd4fc87ac262256e161e8

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib36375525dd11d62d9f5566c714e76876892d9d7
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Delete the deprecated Edit Flavor feature

Historically, Horizon has provided the ability to edit Flavors by
deleting and creating a new one with the same information. This is not
supported in the Nova API and causes unexpected issues and breakages.

Change-Id: I796259c66e01be088a50ab6ba63f515de9590c9b
Closes-Bug: #1751354

I got curious about this. Upper case sharp S _is_ 'SS', see page five of http://www.unicode.org/charts/PDF/U0080.pdf

So python3 is fixing a bug.

But yeah, the fix in the follow up (translation before upper) is correct and good."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-10 18:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2018-04-10 17:26:28.000000000', 'message': "Test case: ResourceClass.normalize_name with ß

Demonstrates the cited bug by invoking ResourceClass.normalize_name on a
string containing sharp S ('ß').  The result is different for py2 and
py3.

Change-Id: I632995c1a234f26f05ef0b5675e0e22b9866b03d
Related-Bug: #1762789
"}]
commit_message:
Test case: ResourceClass.normalize_name with ß

Demonstrates the cited bug by invoking ResourceClass.normalize_name on a
string containing sharp S ('ß').  The result is different for py2 and
py3.

Change-Id: I632995c1a234f26f05ef0b5675e0e22b9866b03d

commit_message:
turn on container updates for upstream multinode

container updates have been turned on for the
3rd party tripleo jobs in software factory [1] since
Jan 24 2018.  I believe this should be reliable
enough for upstream at this point.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/529399/

Change-Id: I8868bf6974fdf268b9deed84c69ff0479df3f080

subject: Revert "unpause Gentoo"
messages: [{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-04-15 15:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-04-15 15:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nself approving to stop nodepool-builder from building failed images'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-15 15:44:19.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "unpause Gentoo"

Our elements in project-config don't appear to support gentoo, revert
until we can fix.

  2018-04-15 15:37:10.971 | Failed to enable unit, unit iptables.service does not exist.

  http://nb01.openstack.org/gentoo-17-0-systemd-0000000757.log

This reverts commit b4950fe8a59b6ddc2e8cb15e2ce2846660d1fc55.

Change-Id: I8568ed46f834feba772b6d1f6a4d0656f80b6005
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "unpause Gentoo"

Our elements in project-config don't appear to support gentoo, revert
until we can fix.

  2018-04-15 15:37:10.971 | Failed to enable unit, unit iptables.service does not exist.

  http://nb01.openstack.org/gentoo-17-0-systemd-0000000757.log

This reverts commit b4950fe8a59b6ddc2e8cb15e2ce2846660d1fc55.

Change-Id: I8568ed46f834feba772b6d1f6a4d0656f80b6005
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use the same namespace for all docker registries

Use the same namespace "tripleo(release)" for all registries,
including docker.io and trunk.rdoproject.org
depends-on: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/13128

Change-Id: I0e594e8c80c52be482a78d688f253f5398a5bc55
